campaign_city: Port of Spain, Trinidad and Tobago

story:
Click Here for the English version of our pitch text!

Nosotros somos Tagma, la organización detrás de la construcción de la primera escuela pública sustentable del continente, construida en febrero de 2016 en la localidad uruguaya de Jaureguiberry. Ahora, queremos construir una escuela sustentable en cada país de la región y nuestro próximo desafío es levantar Una Escuela Sustentable Argentina, en la localidad de Mar Chiquita, al sureste de la provincia de Buenos Aires.

Queremos impulsar e implementar un modelo de escuela cuyo corazón sea un edificio autosustentable que minimice costos operativos y facilite aprendizajes significativos sobre innovación y sustentabilidad para los niños y niñas que la habitan y para la comunidad que lo rodea.

El edificio

El edificio de 270 m2 será levantado en tan sólo siete semanas, entre marzo y abril de 2018 y cumplirá con los seis principios centrales del método Earthship desarrollado por el reconocido arquitecto Michael Reynolds, quién liderará la construcción junto a su equipo:

  1. Utilización de materiales reciclados en la obra (cubiertas, botellas de plástico y de vidrio, latas y cartón).
  2. Recolección de agua de lluvia para abastecimiento
  3. Energías renovables (paneles fotovoltaicos)
  4. Reutilización de las aguas dentro del edificio
  5. Acondicionamiento térmico pasivo (la temperatura se mantiene estable durante todo el año sin necesidad de fuentes artificiales térmicas)
  6. Producción de alimentos orgánicos en huerta interna y externa

En la construcción participarán más de 100 voluntarios llegados de todo el mundo para aprender el método constructivo y al mismo tiempo participar de esta experiencia única. Ellos trabajarán con la comunidad local, el equipo de Earthship Biotecture y el de Tagma, para construir el edificio en apenas 45 días.

El proyecto

El proyecto Una Escuela Sustentable Argentina comenzó a principios de 2017, cuando identificamos a la localidad de Mar Chiquita como el lugar ideal para recibir esta nueva escuela.

En la localidad, entramos en contacto con tres actores claves para el proyecto: la Asociación Civil Amartya, socios en el componente educativo comunitario del proyecto, el Municipio de Mar Chiquita, que nos brindó su respaldo institucional y la comunidad escolar de la escuela N°12 que recibirá el nuevo edificio.

Durante este año y el que viene, trabajaremos junto con Amartya en tres niveles: con los niños y niñas de la escuela N°12 y el equipo escolar, con sus familias y con la comunidad local, con el fin de lograr que se apropien del edificio y sepan aprovechar sus recursos al máximo, tanto desde el punto de vista funcional, como desde el punto de vista pedagógico, educativo y social.

Financiación

El proyecto Una Escuela Sustentable Argentina tiene un presupuesto que supera los 400.000 dólares y será donado totalmente al estado. Gran parte de esta financiación proviene de sponsors que hemos conseguido a lo largo de nuestro camino, otra parte, la aportan con trabajo y apoyo logístico y material el Municipio de Mar Chiquita y los equipos de Tagma y Amartya. Otra fuente de financiamiento es la realización de cursos y talleres que nos permiten compartir el conocimiento generado en estas experiencias. Y además, sumamos esta fuente de financiamiento colectivo que nos permitirá específicamente asegurar el trabajo educativo y comunitario durante todo el 2018 potenciando la apropiación del edificio por parte de la comunidad y el éxito final del proyecto.

Para esta última fuente de financiamiento, hemos pensado una serie de retornos que van desde lo local a lo virtual y que apuntan a difundir el proyecto y al mismo tiempo dar a nuestros colaboradores nuevos conocimientos.

La meta fijada por esta campaña esta directamente asociada al trabajo que nuestro equipo desarrollará durante todo el 2018 para lograr la correcta apropiación del edificio por parte de la comunidad. Esto incluye talleres, reuniones, traslados, el desarrollo y la supervisión de un programa educativo y una propuesta comunitaria que conviertan a la nueva escuela en un motor de cambio para quienes la habitan y un centro de innovación para el pueblo que la rodea. ¡Mientras más nos acerquemos a la meta, más tiempo podremos trabajar en este objetivo! 

English

 

¡We are going to build the first sustainable public school in Argentina! This school will be the perfect place for children to grow in direct contact with experiences of sustainability, protection of the environment, recycling and develop a sustainable relationship with the world that surrounds them, becoming an engine of change and bringing their knowledge to the entire community. Get on board!

We are Tagma, the organization behind the construction of the very first sustainable public school in the continent, built in february 2016 in the uruguayan town named Jaureguiberry. Now, we want to build a sustainable school in each country of the region and our next challenge is to rise The Sustainable School Argentina, in the town of Mar Chiquita, in the southeast of Buenos Aires province.

We want to promote and implement a school model whose heart is a self-sustaining building that minimizes operating costs and facilitates significant learning about innovation and sustainability for the children who live there and for the community that surrounds it.

The Building

The 270 m2 building will be raised in just seven weeks, between March and April 2018 and will comply with the six core principles of the Earthship method developed by renowned architect Michael Reynolds, who will lead the construction with his team:

  1. Use of recycled materials on site (tires, plastic and glass bottles, cans and cardboard).
  2. Rainwater harvesting for water supply
  3. Renewable energies (photovoltaic panels)
  4. Reuse of the water inside the building
  5. Passive thermal conditioning (the temperature remains stable throughout the year without the need for artificial thermal sources)
  6. Production of organic food in internal and external orchards

More than 100 volunteers from all over the world will participate in the construction to learn the constructive method and at the same time they will participate in this unique experience.

They will work with the local community, the Earthship Biotecture and Tagma teams, to build the school in just 45 days.

 

The project

The project A Sustainable School Argentina began in early 2017, when we identified the town of Mar Chiquita as the ideal place to receive this new school.

In town, we contacted three key actors for the project: the Amartya Civil Association, partners in the community and educational component of the project, the Municipality of Mar Chiquita, which provided us with institutional support and the community of the school N°12 who will receive the new building.

During this and next year, we will work together with Amartya on three levels: with the children of the school N°12 and the teachers, with their families and with the local community, in order to get them to appropriate the building and know how to make the most of their resources, both from a functional point of view and from a pedagogical, educational and social point of view.

 

Financing

The project A Sustainable School Argentina has a budget that exceeds $ 400,000 and will be donated to the state. A large part of this funding comes from sponsors that we have obtained along our way, another part is contributed by work and logistical and material support of the Municipality of Mar Chiquita and the Tagma and Amartya teams. Another funding source is the realization of courses and workshops that allow us to share the knowledge generated in these experiences. In addition, we add this source of collective financing that will allow us to specifically ensure educational and community work throughout 2018, promoting the appropriation of the building by the community and the final success of the project.

For this last source of funding, we have thought a series of returns that go from local to virtual and that aim to spread the project and at the same time give our collaborators new knowledge.

The goal set by this campaign is directly associated with the work that our team will develop throughout 2018 to achieve the correct appropriation of the building by the community. This includes workshops, meetings, transfers, the development and supervision of an educational program and a community proposal that will make the new school an engine of change for those who inhabit it and a center of innovation for the people that surround it. The closer we get to the goal, the longer we can work on this!

 

METAS Y FINANCIAMIENTO

TOPE: USD 90.000

Con USD 40.000 - Es 1 de marzo y logramos comprar todos los materiales y equipos para finalizar la construcción de la primera escuela pública autosustentable de Argentina!

Con USD 60.000 - Llegamos al 30 de abril de 2018 y podemos retribuir el trabajo de todos los técnicos, profesionales y emprendendores que hacen posible la construcción del edificio, la ejecución de los talleres educativos y experiencias comunitarias en Mar Chiquita y el equipo de comunicación que llevará nuestro mensaje al mundo!

Con USD 90.000 - Llega noviembre de 2018 y logramos llevar adelante talleres educativos para los niños de las escuela Sustentable de Mar Chiquita, capacitaciones para todo el personal docente, talleres para todas las escuelas públicas de Mar Chiquita, visitas al edificio para los interesados en conocer más sobre esta experiencia, generamos charlas y presentaciones en diferentes puntos de Latinoamérica, pudimos responder y acompañar a diferentes proyectos e intereses de la región.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

STOP: USD 90,000

With USD 40,000 - It is March 1 and we managed to buy all the materials and equipment to complete the construction of the first self-sustaining public school in Argentina!

With USD 60,000 - We arrive at April 30, 2018 and we can reward the work of all the technicians, professionals and entrepreneurs that make possible the construction of the building, the execution of educational workshops and community experiences in Mar Chiquita and the communication team that will take our message to the world!

With USD 90,000 - November 2018 arrives and we managed to carry out educational workshops for the children of the Mar Chiquita Sustainable School, training for all the teaching staff, workshops for all the public schools of Mar Chiquita, visits to the building for those interested in knowing more about this experience, we generated talks and presentations in different parts of Latin America, we were able to respond and accompany different projects and interests from the region.

Nuestras recompensas / Our rewards

1. if you want to collaborate 
We thank you so much for your invaluable collaboration to the construction of the Argentina Sustainable School project!

1. Si quieres colaborar 
Te agradecemos mucho por tu invalorable colaboración para la construcción del proyecto Una Escuela Sustentable Argentina.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

2. It’s you in our social networks - 
We specially thank your collaboration in the Sustainable School project social networks, becoming a part of a huge network of people interested in the construction of a different education.  

2. Tu en nuestras redes sociales

Agradecemos especialmente tu colaboración en las redes sociales del proyecto Una Escuela Sustentable, convirtiéndote en parte de una gran red de personas interesadas en la construcción de una educación diferente.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

3. Become a part of the foundations of the Sustainable School 
You write a message you want to be forever in this school. We’ll put it in a piece of cardboard that it’s going to be inside the tires that serve as foundations for the building and send you a picture of it. This way, your wishes will always be a part of the first Sustainable School in Argentina.

3. Sé parte de los cimientos de la Escuela Sustentable!
Tu nombre y un mensaje personalizado por ti en un cartón reciclado que servirá en cimiento de Una Escuela Sustentable Argentina dentro de los neumáticos con los que vamos a construir el edificio. ¡Siempre serás parte de esta increíble escuela! - 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

4. Digital copy of "30 photographs, 30 stories" 
We created a book with a selection of the most inspiring moments of the construction of the first self-sustainable public school in Latin America, built by representatives from 30 different countries.

In "30 photographs, 30 stories", you will find representative photos of different moments of the project, accompanied by narrations of people from completely different origins, who create an unforgettable story about the construction of a collective dream.

We send you a digital copy of the book.

4. Copia digital de “30 fotografías , 30 historias” -
Creamos un libro con una selección de los más inspiradores momentos de la construcción de la primera escuela pública autosustentable de Latinoamérica, construida por representantes de 30 países diferentes.

En “30 fotografías, 30 historias”, vas a encontrar fotos representativas de diferentes momentos del proyecto, acompañados por narraciones de personas de orígenes completamente diferentes, pero que juntos crean un relato imperdible sobre la construcción de un sueño colectivo.

Te enviamos una copia digital del libro.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
5. You in the I BUILD wall

In www.unaescuelasustentable.com we are going to create a Digital Wall with the faces of all the people that made possible the construction of the first self-sustainable public school in Argentina.
Collaborate with us and be part of this wall, hoping to be thousands!

5. Tu en el muro de Yo Construyo 
En www.unaescuelasustentable.com vamos a crear un Muro Digital con los rostros de todas las personas que hicieron posible la construcción de la primera escuela pública autosustentable de Argentina.

Colaborá con nosotros y sé parte de este muro en el que ojalá seamos miles!

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

6. Stay in the Earthship Community! 

Spend 2 nights in a Global Model Earthship for up to 4 people, and take a special tour by Kirsten Jacobsen (Director of the Earthship Academy) through the Earthship Community and the Reach Community .

*transfers and food not included / only one Stay available

6. Estadía en la comunidad Earthship

Hospédate dos noches en un Earthship Global Model para cuatro personas, y toma un tour especial a cargo de la directora de la Academia Earthship, Kirsten Jacobsen a través de la comunidad Earthship en Taos

* No incluye traslados ni alimentación. / sólo una estadía disponible

 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

7. A Set of Earthship Books signed by Michael Reynolds 

Earthship: How to Build Your Own
Volumes 1, 2, and 3
The original "Earthship: How to Build Your Own" series of books explain the theory and rationale behind the Earthship concept.  The three volumes build upon each other starting with construction instructions for a basic “U” module then getting in to water systems and community concepts. The books include step-by-step instruction on basic construction techniques such as tire pounding, can wall laying, adobe mud pack out and plaster.  

Journey: Part One (1969-1989)
An exciting narrative of the first 20 years of experimentation and development of new methods of living set against the background of the "Wild West" of Taos, New Mexico.  Michael Reynolds explains the origins of some of his most important concepts and tells humorous anecdotes about some of his struggles with early experimental structures.  Full of many historic photos and drawings.

3 sets available

*Shipping not included

 

7. Un set de libros de Earthship firmado por Michael Reynolds 
"Cómo construir tu propio Eartship"
Volúmenes 1, 2 y 3
La serie original de libros "Cómo construir tu propio Eartship" explica la teoría y el razonamiento detrás del concepto de la NaveTierra. Los tres volúmenes se complementan entre sí, comenzando con las instrucciones de construcción para un módulo "U" básico y luego entrando en los sistemas de agua y los conceptos de la comunidad. Los libros incluyen instrucciones paso a paso sobre las técnicas básicas de construcción, como el rellenado de cubiertas, la construcción de muros con latas y más.


El Viaje: Parte uno (1969-1989)
Una emocionante narración de los primeros 20 años de experimentación y desarrollo de nuevas formas de vida en el contexto del "Salvaje Oeste" de Taos, Nuevo México. Michael Reynolds explica los orígenes de algunos de sus conceptos más importantes y cuenta anécdotas humorísticas sobre algunas de sus luchas con las primeras estructuras experimentales. Incluye muchas fotos y dibujos históricos.

3 juegos de libros disponibles

*No incluye envío
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

8. Meet Michael Reynolds in Buenos Aires 
During the construction of A Sustainable School - Argentina, Michael Reynolds will present in Buenos Aires a unique conference about this incredible collaborative process in a round-trip dialogue with the local public.


In addition, the creators of the program A Sustainable School will present the experience as a prologue to the conference of the renowned American architect, who will talk about his history, the history of Earthship Biotecture, and the construction methodology that has developed over the last 45 years. 

8. Conocé a Michael Reynolds en Buenos Aires 
Durante la construcción de Una Escuela Sustentable Argentina, Michael Reynolds se presentará en la ciudad de Buenos Aires para dar una charla única sobre este increíble proceso colaborativo en una diálogo de ida y vuelta con el público local.

Además, los creadores del programa Una Escuela Sustentable presentarán la experiencia como prólogo a la conferencia del reconocido arquitecto norteamericano donde hablará de su historia, la historia de Earthship Biotecture y la metodología de construcción que ha desarrollado durante los últimos 45 años.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

9. Meet Michael Reynolds in Mar del Plata
During the construction of A Sustainable School - Argentina, Michael Reynolds will present in Mar del Plata a unique conference about this incredible collaborative process in a round-trip dialogue with the local public.


In addition, the creators of the program A Sustainable School will present the experience as a prologue to the conference of the renowned American architect, who will talk about his history, the history of Earthship Biotecture, and the construction methodology that has developed over the last 45 years. .

Date: March 22

Location: MAR Museum

Maximum capacity: 200 people
Does not include transport or accommodation.

9. Conocé a Michael Reynolds en Mar del Plata 
Durante la construcción de Una Escuela Sustentable Argentina, Michael Reynolds se presentará en la ciudad de Mar del Plata para dar una charla única sobre este increíble proceso colaborativo en una diálogo de ida y vuelta con el público local.

Además, los creadores del programa Una Escuela Sustentable presentarán la experiencia como prólogo a la conferencia del reconocido arquitecto norteamericano donde hablará de su historia, la historia de Earthship Biotecture y la metodología de construcción que ha desarrollado durante los últimos 45 años.

Fecha: 22 de marzo - 18 a 20 horas
Lugar: Museo MAR
Capacidad máxima: 200 personas

* No incluye pasajes ni alojamiento.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

10. Guided and personalized visit to the building, by the leaders of Earthship and Tagma 
Participate in a special tour of the building while we build it!
The creators and builders of the project will present you the constructive method, the sustainability systems and anecdotes and stories of the creation process of the project.
It will be an opportunity to have a close look to the incredible rhythm of a sustainable work that is materialized in just 45 days!
 

The tours will take place between March 8 and April 15, 2018.
Duration of the tour: 1 hour
Maximum capacity of each tour: 15 people
* Does not include tickets or accommodation.

10. Visita guiada y personalizada al edificio, a cargo de los líderes de Earthship y Tagma 

Participa de un tour especial por el edificio mientras es construido!
Los propios creadores y constructores del proyecto te presentarán el método constructivo, los sistemas de sustentabilidad y anécdotas e historias del proceso de creación del proyecto.

Será una oportunidad de ver desde adentro el ritmo increíble de una obra sustentable que se concreta en tan solo 45 días!

Los recorridos se realizarán entre el 8 de marzo y el 15 de abril de 2018.
Duración del recorrido: 1 hora
Capacidad máxima de cada tour: 15 personas

* No incluye pasajes ni alojamiento.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

11. A week in A Sustainable School during the Earthship Academy 

It includes:
- Introduction and guidance for the building and the project A Sustainable School by technicians of Earthship and Tagma
- Private talk by Michael Reynolds
- Daily integration activities: support in construction site, support in kitchen, support in the development of cultural activities, support in activities of community bonding, support in visits of the public to the building, support in training tasks (at choice).
- Self-sufficient construction + sustainability systems workshops
- Workshop on creation of environmental projects
- Collaborative economy workshop by Amartya
- Participation in construction closing celebrations

Date: March 23-28
Maximum quota: 40 people
Includes: Camping accommodation and lunches
* Does not include transfers

11.  Viví una semana en Una Escuela Sustentable durante la Academia Earthship - 

Incluye:
- Introducción y guía por el edificio y el proyecto Una Escuela Sustentable por parte de técnicos Earthship y Tagma
- Charla privada por parte de Michael Reynolds
- Actividades de integración diarias : apoyo en sitio de construcción, apoyo en cocina, apoyo en desarrollo de actividades culturales, apoyo en actividades de vinculación comunitaria, apoyo en visitas de público al edificio, apoyo en tareas de capacitación (a elección).
- Talleres de construcción autosuficiente + sistemas de sustentabilidad
- Taller sobre creación de proyectos medioambientales
- Taller de economía colaborativa por parte de Amartya
- Participación en festejos de cierre de Construcción

Fecha: 23 al 28 de marzo
Cupo Máximo: 40 personas
Incluye: Alojamiento en camping y almuerzos

* No incluye traslados

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

12. Build A Sustainable School with us! 
Participate in a theoretical-practical construction workshop presented by Earthship Biotecture and developed by Tagma and N4VE (Argentine organization representing Earthship Biotecture) that conclude the completion of the first 100% sustainable public school in Argentina.
2 WORKSHOPS from April 2 to 14
WORKSHOP 1: 2 to April 7
WORKSHOP 2: 9 to April 14
 

THEORETICAL CONTENTS
1.1 History of Earthship and the project A Sustainable School
2.1 Methodologies and construction techniques
2.2 Communities and Retrofit
2.3 N + T - Construction and work stages (9 steps)
3.1 Natural and Recycled Materials
3.2 Food production
3.3 Water treatment and reuse system
4.1 Efficient thermal conditioning
4.2 Renewable energy systems
4.3 Biodigesters
5.1 Project management
5.2 Plans and permits
5.3 Approach to Communities
PRACTICAL CONTENTS
Work on site with N4VE and Tagma technicians in different stations

Quotas per workshop: 15 students
Includes: Lunches + accommodation at Camping de Mar Chiquita
* Does not include transfers

 

12. Construí Una Escuela Sustentable! 
Participá en un taller de construcción teórico-práctico presentado por Earthship Biotecture y desarrollados por Tagma y N4VE (organización argentina que representa a Earthship Biotecture) que concluyen en la finalización de la primera escuela pública 100% sustentable de Argentina.

2 TALLERES del 2 al 14 de abril
TALLER 1 : 2 al 7 de abril
TALLER 2 : 9 al 14 de abril

CONTENIDOS TEÓRICOS
1.1 Historia Earthship y proyecto Una Escuela Sustetable
2.1 Metodologías y técnicas constructivas
2.2 Comunidades  y Retrofit
2.3 N+T - Construcción y etapas de trabajo (9 pasos)
3.1 Materiales Naturales y Reciclados
3.2 Producción de alimentos
3.3 Sistema de tratamiento y reutilización de aguas
4.1 Acondicionamiento térmico eficiente
4.2 Sistemas de energías renovables
4.3 Biodigestores
5.1 Gestión de proyectos
5.2 Planos y permisos
5.3 Acercamiento a Comunidades
CONTENIDOS PRÁCTICOS
Trabajo en obra a cargo de técnicos N4VE y Tagma en diferentes estaciones

Cupos por taller : 15 estudiantes
Incluye : Almuerzos + alojamiento en Camping de Mar Chiquita

* No incluye traslados

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

13. Presentation and motivational talk of the project A Sustainable School

The Project Director, together with technicians responsible for executing the project, will carry out presentations and conversations for the staff of companies and social organizations.

It is an informative and highly motivational talk that reviews the history and development of A Sustainable School project in Uruguay and Argentina, as well as the work process necessary to carry out a unique experience in the world.

The presentation includes:

- History and details of the project A Sustainable School

- Concepts of articulation with government entities, companies, organizations and communities in the development of triple impact projects

- Sustainable Architecture and 7 sustainability principles associated with the project.

- Conversation on the previous points.

* Talks could be in the school after opening

* Does not include transfers or accommodation for the team of A Sustainable School. They must be managed by the contracting party.

13. Presentación y charla motivacional del proyecto Una Escuela Sustentable 

El Director del proyecto junto a técnicos responsables por la ejecución del mismo llevarán adelante presentaciones y conversaciones para el personal de empresas y organizaciones sociales.

Es una charla informativa y altamente motivacional que repasa la historia y el desarrollo del proyecto Una Escuela Sustentable en Uruguay y Argentina, así como el proceso de trabajo necesario para llevar adelante una experiencia única en el mundo.

La presentación incluye:
- Historia y detalles del proyecto Una Escuela Sustentable
- Conceptos de articulación con entes gubernamentales, empresas, organizaciones y comunidades en el desarrollo de proyectos de triple impacto
- Arquitectura Sustentable y 7 principios de sustentabilidad asociados al proyecto.
- Conversación sobre los puntos anteriores.

*Charlas en a escuela luego de inaugurada

*no incluye traslados ni alojamiento para el equipo de Una Escuela Sustentable. Los mismos deberán ser gestionados por el contratante.

 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

14. The Team of A Sustainable School helps you to carry out your project!

We offer you an accompaniment for the development of your project, wherever you are in the world!

The accompaniment is  given by those responsible for A Sustainable School project together with technical specialists.

With the objective of going through different stages oriented to organize the fundamental resources of a project as well as accessing to fundamental tools for the project development and success.

CONTENTS

- Design of triple impact projects

- Conformation, management of work teams and coordination

- Work with target audience, validation and networking

- Financing strategies

- Communication strategies

- Implementation strategies

- Systematization of information for upcoming implementations.

IT INCLUDES

- Practical tools for project work

- Accompaniment by technicians of a Sustainable School during the work stages

* Each accompaniment should be coordinated 2 months in advance and have a maximum extension of two months.

14. El equipo de Una Escuela Sustentable te ayuda a llevar adelante tu proyecto! 
Te ofrecemos un acompañamiento para el desarrollo de tu proyecto estés donde estés en el mundo!
El acompañamiento será llevado adelante por los responsables del proyecto Una Escuela Sustentable y técnicos especializados.
Tiene el objetivo de transitar diferentes etapas orientadas a organizar los recursos fundamentales de un proyecto así como acceder a herramientas fundamentales para el desarrollo y el éxito de los mismos.

CONTENIDOS
- Diseño de proyectos de triple impacto
- Conformación, gestión de equipos de trabajo y coordinación
- Trabajo con público objetivo, validación y creación de redes
- Estrategias de financiación
- Estrategias de comunicación
- Estrategias de implementación
- Sistematización de información para próximas implementaciones.

INCLUYE
- Herramientas prácticas para el trabajo en proyecto
- Acompañamiento por técnicos de Una Escuela Sustentable durante las etapas de trabajo

* Cada acompañamiento debería ser coordinado con 2 meses de anticipación y tendrá una duración máxima de 2 meses.
story_txt:
Click Here for the English version of our pitch text!Nosotros somos Tagma, la organización detrás de la construcción de la primera escuela pública sustentable del continente, construida en febrero de 2016 en la localidad uruguaya de Jaureguiberry. Ahora, queremos construir una escuela sustentable en cada país de la región y nuestro próximo desafío es levantar Una Escuela Sustentable Argentina, en la localidad de Mar Chiquita, al sureste de la provincia de Buenos Aires.Queremos impulsar e implementar un modelo de escuela cuyo corazón sea un edificio autosustentable que minimice costos operativos y facilite aprendizajes significativos sobre innovación y sustentabilidad para los niños y niñas que la habitan y para la comunidad que lo rodea.El edificioEl edificio de 270 m2 será levantado en tan sólo siete semanas, entre marzo y abril de 2018 y cumplirá con los seis principios centrales del método Earthship desarrollado por el reconocido arquitecto Michael Reynolds, quién liderará la construcción junto a su equipo:
Utilización de materiales reciclados en la obra (cubiertas, botellas de plástico y de vidrio, latas y cartón).
Recolección de agua de lluvia para abastecimiento
Energías renovables (paneles fotovoltaicos)
Reutilización de las aguas dentro del edificio
Acondicionamiento térmico pasivo (la temperatura se mantiene estable durante todo el año sin necesidad de fuentes artificiales térmicas)
Producción de alimentos orgánicos en huerta interna y externa
En la construcción participarán más de 100 voluntarios llegados de todo el mundo para aprender el método constructivo y al mismo tiempo participar de esta experiencia única. Ellos trabajarán con la comunidad local, el equipo de Earthship Biotecture y el de Tagma, para construir el edificio en apenas 45 días.El proyectoEl proyecto Una Escuela Sustentable Argentina comenzó a principios de 2017, cuando identificamos a la localidad de Mar Chiquita como el lugar ideal para recibir esta nueva escuela.En la localidad, entramos en contacto con tres actores claves para el proyecto: la Asociación Civil Amartya, socios en el componente educativo comunitario del proyecto, el Municipio de Mar Chiquita, que nos brindó su respaldo institucional y la comunidad escolar de la escuela N°12 que recibirá el nuevo edificio.Durante este año y el que viene, trabajaremos junto con Amartya en tres niveles: con los niños y niñas de la escuela N°12 y el equipo escolar, con sus familias y con la comunidad local, con el fin de lograr que se apropien del edificio y sepan aprovechar sus recursos al máximo, tanto desde el punto de vista funcional, como desde el punto de vista pedagógico, educativo y social.FinanciaciónEl proyecto Una Escuela Sustentable Argentina tiene un presupuesto que supera los 400.000 dólares y será donado totalmente al estado. Gran parte de esta financiación proviene de sponsors que hemos conseguido a lo largo de nuestro camino, otra parte, la aportan con trabajo y apoyo logístico y material el Municipio de Mar Chiquita y los equipos de Tagma y Amartya. Otra fuente de financiamiento es la realización de cursos y talleres que nos permiten compartir el conocimiento generado en estas experiencias. Y además, sumamos esta fuente de financiamiento colectivo que nos permitirá específicamente asegurar el trabajo educativo y comunitario durante todo el 2018 potenciando la apropiación del edificio por parte de la comunidad y el éxito final del proyecto.Para esta última fuente de financiamiento, hemos pensado una serie de retornos que van desde lo local a lo virtual y que apuntan a difundir el proyecto y al mismo tiempo dar a nuestros colaboradores nuevos conocimientos.La meta fijada por esta campaña esta directamente asociada al trabajo que nuestro equipo desarrollará durante todo el 2018 para lograr la correcta apropiación del edificio por parte de la comunidad. Esto incluye talleres, reuniones, traslados, el desarrollo y la supervisión de un programa educativo y una propuesta comunitaria que conviertan a la nueva escuela en un motor de cambio para quienes la habitan y un centro de innovación para el pueblo que la rodea. ¡Mientras más nos acerquemos a la meta, más tiempo podremos trabajar en este objetivo! English ¡We are going to build the first sustainable public school in Argentina! This school will be the perfect place for children to grow in direct contact with experiences of sustainability, protection of the environment, recycling and develop a sustainable relationship with the world that surrounds them, becoming an engine of change and bringing their knowledge to the entire community. Get on board!We are Tagma, the organization behind the construction of the very first sustainable public school in the continent, built in february 2016 in the uruguayan town named Jaureguiberry. Now, we want to build a sustainable school in each country of the region and our next challenge is to rise The Sustainable School Argentina, in the town of Mar Chiquita, in the southeast of Buenos Aires province.We want to promote and implement a school model whose heart is a self-sustaining building that minimizes operating costs and facilitates significant learning about innovation and sustainability for the children who live there and for the community that surrounds it.The BuildingThe 270 m2 building will be raised in just seven weeks, between March and April 2018 and will comply with the six core principles of the Earthship method developed by renowned architect Michael Reynolds, who will lead the construction with his team:
Use of recycled materials on site (tires, plastic and glass bottles, cans and cardboard).
Rainwater harvesting for water supply
Renewable energies (photovoltaic panels)
Reuse of the water inside the building
Passive thermal conditioning (the temperature remains stable throughout the year without the need for artificial thermal sources)
Production of organic food in internal and external orchards
More than 100 volunteers from all over the world will participate in the construction to learn the constructive method and at the same time they will participate in this unique experience.They will work with the local community, the Earthship Biotecture and Tagma teams, to build the school in just 45 days. The projectThe project A Sustainable School Argentina began in early 2017, when we identified the town of Mar Chiquita as the ideal place to receive this new school.In town, we contacted three key actors for the project: the Amartya Civil Association, partners in the community and educational component of the project, the Municipality of Mar Chiquita, which provided us with institutional support and the community of the school N°12 who will receive the new building.During this and next year, we will work together with Amartya on three levels: with the children of the school N°12 and the teachers, with their families and with the local community, in order to get them to appropriate the building and know how to make the most of their resources, both from a functional point of view and from a pedagogical, educational and social point of view. FinancingThe project A Sustainable School Argentina has a budget that exceeds $ 400,000 and will be donated to the state. A large part of this funding comes from sponsors that we have obtained along our way, another part is contributed by work and logistical and material support of the Municipality of Mar Chiquita and the Tagma and Amartya teams. Another funding source is the realization of courses and workshops that allow us to share the knowledge generated in these experiences. In addition, we add this source of collective financing that will allow us to specifically ensure educational and community work throughout 2018, promoting the appropriation of the building by the community and the final success of the project.For this last source of funding, we have thought a series of returns that go from local to virtual and that aim to spread the project and at the same time give our collaborators new knowledge.The goal set by this campaign is directly associated with the work that our team will develop throughout 2018 to achieve the correct appropriation of the building by the community. This includes workshops, meetings, transfers, the development and supervision of an educational program and a community proposal that will make the new school an engine of change for those who inhabit it and a center of innovation for the people that surround it. The closer we get to the goal, the longer we can work on this! METAS Y FINANCIAMIENTOTOPE: USD 90.000Con USD 40.000 - Es 1 de marzo y logramos comprar todos los materiales y equipos para finalizar la construcción de la primera escuela pública autosustentable de Argentina!Con USD 60.000 - Llegamos al 30 de abril de 2018 y podemos retribuir el trabajo de todos los técnicos, profesionales y emprendendores que hacen posible la construcción del edificio, la ejecución de los talleres educativos y experiencias comunitarias en Mar Chiquita y el equipo de comunicación que llevará nuestro mensaje al mundo!Con USD 90.000 - Llega noviembre de 2018 y logramos llevar adelante talleres educativos para los niños de las escuela Sustentable de Mar Chiquita, capacitaciones para todo el personal docente, talleres para todas las escuelas públicas de Mar Chiquita, visitas al edificio para los interesados en conocer más sobre esta experiencia, generamos charlas y presentaciones en diferentes puntos de Latinoamérica, pudimos responder y acompañar a diferentes proyectos e intereses de la región.---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------STOP: USD 90,000With USD 40,000 - It is March 1 and we managed to buy all the materials and equipment to complete the construction of the first self-sustaining public school in Argentina!With USD 60,000 - We arrive at April 30, 2018 and we can reward the work of all the technicians, professionals and entrepreneurs that make possible the construction of the building, the execution of educational workshops and community experiences in Mar Chiquita and the communication team that will take our message to the world!With USD 90,000 - November 2018 arrives and we managed to carry out educational workshops for the children of the Mar Chiquita Sustainable School, training for all the teaching staff, workshops for all the public schools of Mar Chiquita, visits to the building for those interested in knowing more about this experience, we generated talks and presentations in different parts of Latin America, we were able to respond and accompany different projects and interests from the region.Nuestras recompensas / Our rewards1. if you want to collaborate We thank you so much for your invaluable collaboration to the construction of the Argentina Sustainable School project!1. Si quieres colaborar Te agradecemos mucho por tu invalorable colaboración para la construcción del proyecto Una Escuela Sustentable Argentina.-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------2. It’s you in our social networks - We specially thank your collaboration in the Sustainable School project social networks, becoming a part of a huge network of people interested in the construction of a different education.  2. Tu en nuestras redes socialesAgradecemos especialmente tu colaboración en las redes sociales del proyecto Una Escuela Sustentable, convirtiéndote en parte de una gran red de personas interesadas en la construcción de una educación diferente.-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------3. Become a part of the foundations of the Sustainable School You write a message you want to be forever in this school. We’ll put it in a piece of cardboard that it’s going to be inside the tires that serve as foundations for the building and send you a picture of it. This way, your wishes will always be a part of the first Sustainable School in Argentina.3. Sé parte de los cimientos de la Escuela Sustentable!Tu nombre y un mensaje personalizado por ti en un cartón reciclado que servirá en cimiento de Una Escuela Sustentable Argentina dentro de los neumáticos con los que vamos a construir el edificio. ¡Siempre serás parte de esta increíble escuela! - -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------4. Digital copy of "30 photographs, 30 stories" We created a book with a selection of the most inspiring moments of the construction of the first self-sustainable public school in Latin America, built by representatives from 30 different countries.In "30 photographs, 30 stories", you will find representative photos of different moments of the project, accompanied by narrations of people from completely different origins, who create an unforgettable story about the construction of a collective dream.We send you a digital copy of the book.4. Copia digital de “30 fotografías , 30 historias” -Creamos un libro con una selección de los más inspiradores momentos de la construcción de la primera escuela pública autosustentable de Latinoamérica, construida por representantes de 30 países diferentes.En “30 fotografías, 30 historias”, vas a encontrar fotos representativas de diferentes momentos del proyecto, acompañados por narraciones de personas de orígenes completamente diferentes, pero que juntos crean un relato imperdible sobre la construcción de un sueño colectivo.Te enviamos una copia digital del libro.--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------5. You in the I BUILD wallIn www.unaescuelasustentable.com we are going to create a Digital Wall with the faces of all the people that made possible the construction of the first self-sustainable public school in Argentina.Collaborate with us and be part of this wall, hoping to be thousands!5. Tu en el muro de Yo Construyo En www.unaescuelasustentable.com vamos a crear un Muro Digital con los rostros de todas las personas que hicieron posible la construcción de la primera escuela pública autosustentable de Argentina.Colaborá con nosotros y sé parte de este muro en el que ojalá seamos miles!---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------6. Stay in the Earthship Community! Spend 2 nights in a Global Model Earthship for up to 4 people, and take a special tour by Kirsten Jacobsen (Director of the Earthship Academy) through the Earthship Community and the Reach Community .*transfers and food not included / only one Stay available6. Estadía en la comunidad EarthshipHospédate dos noches en un Earthship Global Model para cuatro personas, y toma un tour especial a cargo de la directora de la Academia Earthship, Kirsten Jacobsen a través de la comunidad Earthship en Taos* No incluye traslados ni alimentación. / sólo una estadía disponible ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------7. A Set of Earthship Books signed by Michael Reynolds Earthship: How to Build Your OwnVolumes 1, 2, and 3The original "Earthship: How to Build Your Own" series of books explain the theory and rationale behind the Earthship concept.  The three volumes build upon each other starting with construction instructions for a basic “U” module then getting in to water systems and community concepts. The books include step-by-step instruction on basic construction techniques such as tire pounding, can wall laying, adobe mud pack out and plaster.  Journey: Part One (1969-1989)An exciting narrative of the first 20 years of experimentation and development of new methods of living set against the background of the "Wild West" of Taos, New Mexico.  Michael Reynolds explains the origins of some of his most important concepts and tells humorous anecdotes about some of his struggles with early experimental structures.  Full of many historic photos and drawings.3 sets available*Shipping not included 7. Un set de libros de Earthship firmado por Michael Reynolds "Cómo construir tu propio Eartship"Volúmenes 1, 2 y 3La serie original de libros "Cómo construir tu propio Eartship" explica la teoría y el razonamiento detrás del concepto de la NaveTierra. Los tres volúmenes se complementan entre sí, comenzando con las instrucciones de construcción para un módulo "U" básico y luego entrando en los sistemas de agua y los conceptos de la comunidad. Los libros incluyen instrucciones paso a paso sobre las técnicas básicas de construcción, como el rellenado de cubiertas, la construcción de muros con latas y más.El Viaje: Parte uno (1969-1989)Una emocionante narración de los primeros 20 años de experimentación y desarrollo de nuevas formas de vida en el contexto del "Salvaje Oeste" de Taos, Nuevo México. Michael Reynolds explica los orígenes de algunos de sus conceptos más importantes y cuenta anécdotas humorísticas sobre algunas de sus luchas con las primeras estructuras experimentales. Incluye muchas fotos y dibujos históricos.3 juegos de libros disponibles*No incluye envío---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------8. Meet Michael Reynolds in Buenos Aires During the construction of A Sustainable School - Argentina, Michael Reynolds will present in Buenos Aires a unique conference about this incredible collaborative process in a round-trip dialogue with the local public.In addition, the creators of the program A Sustainable School will present the experience as a prologue to the conference of the renowned American architect, who will talk about his history, the history of Earthship Biotecture, and the construction methodology that has developed over the last 45 years. 8. Conocé a Michael Reynolds en Buenos Aires Durante la construcción de Una Escuela Sustentable Argentina, Michael Reynolds se presentará en la ciudad de Buenos Aires para dar una charla única sobre este increíble proceso colaborativo en una diálogo de ida y vuelta con el público local.Además, los creadores del programa Una Escuela Sustentable presentarán la experiencia como prólogo a la conferencia del reconocido arquitecto norteamericano donde hablará de su historia, la historia de Earthship Biotecture y la metodología de construcción que ha desarrollado durante los últimos 45 años.---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------9. Meet Michael Reynolds in Mar del PlataDuring the construction of A Sustainable School - Argentina, Michael Reynolds will present in Mar del Plata a unique conference about this incredible collaborative process in a round-trip dialogue with the local public.In addition, the creators of the program A Sustainable School will present the experience as a prologue to the conference of the renowned American architect, who will talk about his history, the history of Earthship Biotecture, and the construction methodology that has developed over the last 45 years. .Date: March 22Location: MAR MuseumMaximum capacity: 200 peopleDoes not include transport or accommodation.9. Conocé a Michael Reynolds en Mar del Plata Durante la construcción de Una Escuela Sustentable Argentina, Michael Reynolds se presentará en la ciudad de Mar del Plata para dar una charla única sobre este increíble proceso colaborativo en una diálogo de ida y vuelta con el público local.Además, los creadores del programa Una Escuela Sustentable presentarán la experiencia como prólogo a la conferencia del reconocido arquitecto norteamericano donde hablará de su historia, la historia de Earthship Biotecture y la metodología de construcción que ha desarrollado durante los últimos 45 años.Fecha: 22 de marzo - 18 a 20 horasLugar: Museo MARCapacidad máxima: 200 personas* No incluye pasajes ni alojamiento.---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------10. Guided and personalized visit to the building, by the leaders of Earthship and Tagma Participate in a special tour of the building while we build it!The creators and builders of the project will present you the constructive method, the sustainability systems and anecdotes and stories of the creation process of the project.It will be an opportunity to have a close look to the incredible rhythm of a sustainable work that is materialized in just 45 days! The tours will take place between March 8 and April 15, 2018.Duration of the tour: 1 hourMaximum capacity of each tour: 15 people* Does not include tickets or accommodation.10. Visita guiada y personalizada al edificio, a cargo de los líderes de Earthship y Tagma Participa de un tour especial por el edificio mientras es construido!Los propios creadores y constructores del proyecto te presentarán el método constructivo, los sistemas de sustentabilidad y anécdotas e historias del proceso de creación del proyecto.Será una oportunidad de ver desde adentro el ritmo increíble de una obra sustentable que se concreta en tan solo 45 días!Los recorridos se realizarán entre el 8 de marzo y el 15 de abril de 2018.Duración del recorrido: 1 horaCapacidad máxima de cada tour: 15 personas* No incluye pasajes ni alojamiento.---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------11. A week in A Sustainable School during the Earthship Academy It includes:- Introduction and guidance for the building and the project A Sustainable School by technicians of Earthship and Tagma- Private talk by Michael Reynolds- Daily integration activities: support in construction site, support in kitchen, support in the development of cultural activities, support in activities of community bonding, support in visits of the public to the building, support in training tasks (at choice).- Self-sufficient construction + sustainability systems workshops- Workshop on creation of environmental projects- Collaborative economy workshop by Amartya- Participation in construction closing celebrationsDate: March 23-28Maximum quota: 40 peopleIncludes: Camping accommodation and lunches* Does not include transfers11.  Viví una semana en Una Escuela Sustentable durante la Academia Earthship - Incluye:- Introducción y guía por el edificio y el proyecto Una Escuela Sustentable por parte de técnicos Earthship y Tagma- Charla privada por parte de Michael Reynolds- Actividades de integración diarias : apoyo en sitio de construcción, apoyo en cocina, apoyo en desarrollo de actividades culturales, apoyo en actividades de vinculación comunitaria, apoyo en visitas de público al edificio, apoyo en tareas de capacitación (a elección).- Talleres de construcción autosuficiente + sistemas de sustentabilidad- Taller sobre creación de proyectos medioambientales- Taller de economía colaborativa por parte de Amartya- Participación en festejos de cierre de ConstrucciónFecha: 23 al 28 de marzoCupo Máximo: 40 personasIncluye: Alojamiento en camping y almuerzos* No incluye traslados---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------12. Build A Sustainable School with us! Participate in a theoretical-practical construction workshop presented by Earthship Biotecture and developed by Tagma and N4VE (Argentine organization representing Earthship Biotecture) that conclude the completion of the first 100% sustainable public school in Argentina.2 WORKSHOPS from April 2 to 14WORKSHOP 1: 2 to April 7WORKSHOP 2: 9 to April 14 THEORETICAL CONTENTS1.1 History of Earthship and the project A Sustainable School2.1 Methodologies and construction techniques2.2 Communities and Retrofit2.3 N + T - Construction and work stages (9 steps)3.1 Natural and Recycled Materials3.2 Food production3.3 Water treatment and reuse system4.1 Efficient thermal conditioning4.2 Renewable energy systems4.3 Biodigesters5.1 Project management5.2 Plans and permits5.3 Approach to CommunitiesPRACTICAL CONTENTSWork on site with N4VE and Tagma technicians in different stationsQuotas per workshop: 15 studentsIncludes: Lunches + accommodation at Camping de Mar Chiquita* Does not include transfers 12. Construí Una Escuela Sustentable! Participá en un taller de construcción teórico-práctico presentado por Earthship Biotecture y desarrollados por Tagma y N4VE (organización argentina que representa a Earthship Biotecture) que concluyen en la finalización de la primera escuela pública 100% sustentable de Argentina.2 TALLERES del 2 al 14 de abrilTALLER 1 : 2 al 7 de abrilTALLER 2 : 9 al 14 de abrilCONTENIDOS TEÓRICOS1.1 Historia Earthship y proyecto Una Escuela Sustetable2.1 Metodologías y técnicas constructivas2.2 Comunidades  y Retrofit2.3 N+T - Construcción y etapas de trabajo (9 pasos)3.1 Materiales Naturales y Reciclados3.2 Producción de alimentos3.3 Sistema de tratamiento y reutilización de aguas4.1 Acondicionamiento térmico eficiente4.2 Sistemas de energías renovables4.3 Biodigestores5.1 Gestión de proyectos5.2 Planos y permisos5.3 Acercamiento a ComunidadesCONTENIDOS PRÁCTICOSTrabajo en obra a cargo de técnicos N4VE y Tagma en diferentes estacionesCupos por taller : 15 estudiantesIncluye : Almuerzos + alojamiento en Camping de Mar Chiquita* No incluye traslados---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------13. Presentation and motivational talk of the project A Sustainable SchoolThe Project Director, together with technicians responsible for executing the project, will carry out presentations and conversations for the staff of companies and social organizations.It is an informative and highly motivational talk that reviews the history and development of A Sustainable School project in Uruguay and Argentina, as well as the work process necessary to carry out a unique experience in the world.The presentation includes:- History and details of the project A Sustainable School- Concepts of articulation with government entities, companies, organizations and communities in the development of triple impact projects- Sustainable Architecture and 7 sustainability principles associated with the project.- Conversation on the previous points.* Talks could be in the school after opening* Does not include transfers or accommodation for the team of A Sustainable School. They must be managed by the contracting party.13. Presentación y charla motivacional del proyecto Una Escuela Sustentable El Director del proyecto junto a técnicos responsables por la ejecución del mismo llevarán adelante presentaciones y conversaciones para el personal de empresas y organizaciones sociales.Es una charla informativa y altamente motivacional que repasa la historia y el desarrollo del proyecto Una Escuela Sustentable en Uruguay y Argentina, así como el proceso de trabajo necesario para llevar adelante una experiencia única en el mundo.La presentación incluye:- Historia y detalles del proyecto Una Escuela Sustentable- Conceptos de articulación con entes gubernamentales, empresas, organizaciones y comunidades en el desarrollo de proyectos de triple impacto- Arquitectura Sustentable y 7 principios de sustentabilidad asociados al proyecto.- Conversación sobre los puntos anteriores.*Charlas en a escuela luego de inaugurada*no incluye traslados ni alojamiento para el equipo de Una Escuela Sustentable. Los mismos deberán ser gestionados por el contratante. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------14. The Team of A Sustainable School helps you to carry out your project!We offer you an accompaniment for the development of your project, wherever you are in the world!The accompaniment is  given by those responsible for A Sustainable School project together with technical specialists.With the objective of going through different stages oriented to organize the fundamental resources of a project as well as accessing to fundamental tools for the project development and success.CONTENTS- Design of triple impact projects- Conformation, management of work teams and coordination- Work with target audience, validation and networking- Financing strategies- Communication strategies- Implementation strategies- Systematization of information for upcoming implementations.IT INCLUDES- Practical tools for project work- Accompaniment by technicians of a Sustainable School during the work stages* Each accompaniment should be coordinated 2 months in advance and have a maximum extension of two months.14. El equipo de Una Escuela Sustentable te ayuda a llevar adelante tu proyecto! Te ofrecemos un acompañamiento para el desarrollo de tu proyecto estés donde estés en el mundo!El acompañamiento será llevado adelante por los responsables del proyecto Una Escuela Sustentable y técnicos especializados.Tiene el objetivo de transitar diferentes etapas orientadas a organizar los recursos fundamentales de un proyecto así como acceder a herramientas fundamentales para el desarrollo y el éxito de los mismos.CONTENIDOS- Diseño de proyectos de triple impacto- Conformación, gestión de equipos de trabajo y coordinación- Trabajo con público objetivo, validación y creación de redes- Estrategias de financiación- Estrategias de comunicación- Estrategias de implementación- Sistematización de información para próximas implementaciones.INCLUYE- Herramientas prácticas para el trabajo en proyecto- Acompañamiento por técnicos de Una Escuela Sustentable durante las etapas de trabajo* Cada acompañamiento debería ser coordinado con 2 meses de anticipación y tendrá una duración máxima de 2 meses.

story: Hola! We are students from the Montessori High School in Cleveland Ohio. Every year students from our school conduct a two week intensive study called an xterm. Our goal is to conduct a spanish immersion x-term in Puerto Rico. Here we will not only be able to practice the language but we will also immerse ourselves in the culture. We will focus on language study as well as learn about the island's rich history. Our hope is to be able to have an experience that will benefit us throughout our lives. Thank you for supporting us!

We will focus on language study as well as learn about the island's rich history. Our hope is to be able to have an experience that will benefit us throughout our lives. Thank you for supporting us!

story:
Short Summary

Hello! My name is Mary Van Dyke. I am a second year English teacher at Lompoc Valley Middle School in Lompoc, CA. This year I will be teaching 8th grade English and Beginning ELD. You may know ELD as ESL or English as a Second Language. 

I am spending my time during summer vacation on this website and in my local community trying to raise funds for my classroom. Specifically, I am raising money in order to create a classroom library. As a second year teacher, I have not had much time to collect and grow my supply of age appropriate reading material. I want to give my students all possible advantages and hate thinking that my lack of years as a teacher may be a detriment to them. 

Moreover, many of my students are in particular need of appropriate reading material. Lompoc Valley Middle School serves a community that is both diverse and economically disadvantaged. As a ELD teacher, I often find myself in need of books written with Spanish, Korean, or Arabic translations. Sadly our small school library does not have these specialized materials. Additionally, many of my English speaking students are remedial or reluctant readers. These students also need specialized materials in order to succeed. They need high interest, level appropriate books available to them in the safety and comfort of their own classroom. 

In its simplest form, this is a campaign to buy books for kids in need, but I see it as so much more than that. I see this as an opportunity to give a small measure of power back to a classroom teacher. This is not a problem that can be solved by simply walking kids to a library. They need someone who knows them for guidance.  My students need help obtaining reading material that is appropriate for their reading level and interests. And I need help from my community to acquire these materials. So in the end, this becomes a campaign for community. Each book bought by a complete stranger will be more proof to my students that people really do care and believe that they can succeed. 

What We Need & What You Get

For this campaign, I am asking for a rather modest amount: 2,000 USD. I came to this figure by estimating how many books I will need and how much each book will cost. I have already purchased two, five-shelf bookcases with my own money. Each shelf holds about 20 books. Thus, in order to fill these bookcases I will need about 200 books (20 books x 5 shelves x 2 bookcases). I then estimated the cost of each book at about 10 USD in order to come up with my overall goal of 2,000 USD. I know that many of the books I purchase will be much less than 10 dollars. Used paperback novels sell on Amazon for about half that amount. However, I will also need to buy specialized materials, such as translated novels, that will be more expensive than 10 dollars. Also, I would like to buy some of the latest young adult novels that will not yet be offered as used and thus will be more expensive as well.

Now for the fun part: the perks! This is my favorite part of this campaign because both you as a contributor and my students will be able to see exactly what your money bought: a book! Each dollar earned in this campaign will go toward books and only books. When you contribute, you will get your name and picture (optional) put on the inside cover of the book you helped to purchase under the introduction: "This book was generously donated by:" Donate a small amount and you will be one of several donors who purchase a used or new book together. If you donate a larger amount you can purchase a new or used book all by yourself! Additionally when you chose to donate a larger amount, you will have the option of suggesting what book your donation purchases (as long as it's age appropriate and teacher approved, of course). This is a great way to share your favorite childhood book with a whole new generation. Finally, every donor will receive a personal thank you email from me and donors of a new book will receive a thank you postcard from a student! 

Finally, one of the best parts of this campaign is that I don't even have to reach my entire goal for you to make an impact! Every dollar raised will go towards purchasing a book whether I reach the 2,000 dollar amount or not. You can't lose by donating to this campaign; if you donate, a child will get a book to read!  

The Impact

I've already touched on the specific needs of my particular students. They are English Learners. They are economically disadvantaged. They are remedial and reluctant readers. And they are in need of a teacher who knows them, knows their reading level and interests, and, most importantly, has the resources at hand to support them. 

In addition to giving my students the material assistance they need, I truly believe this show of support from people all over their community, state, country, or even world will give my students the moral encouragement they need to be successful in reading. Many of my students have never been out of the small town of Lompoc where they are from and live. Also, many are from families that, for one reason or another, did not receive much education. I hope this campaign will make my students feel more connected to the world outside Lompoc and more convinced of the value of education. 

Finally, if this project is successful, I hope it will open doors for my school and my fellow teachers. As a new, young teacher, I often get described as idealistic. Many of the veteran teachers at my school look to me, often skeptically, for new ideas, creative uses for modern technology, and sometimes even motivation. I would love for my classroom library of donated books to stand as an example for my school community of what can be accomplished when you think creatively and believe in people.  

Risks & Challenges

I feel like this campaign is unique from other campaigns on this website and websites like it in that there is very little risk to donating. As I said before, any donation you make will buy a book for my classroom library. That said, I believe the challenge for this little campaign will be reaching enough people to meet my intended goal. To this end, I will be launching my own personal campaign to get it attention. I will be reaching out to family, friends, and my local community of Santa Barbara, CA for support and help generating awareness. Which leads me to...

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you cannot donate monetarily, you can still help greatly by spreading the word about this campaign to anyone and everyone you know that can. So please share this campaign on your Facebook page, email the link to coworkers, and tell your family and friends. The more people who know about this campaign the more books will be bought. I cannot tell enough people all by myself. And as I've said many times, while this campaign is about getting needed reading materials to students, it's also about fostering a sense of community and convincing kids that you believe in their ability to succeed, both of which require no money at all. 

    Thank you sincerely for your time and support.

story:
What is TAP?

TAP = Transgender Access Partnership, an initiative of Greater Boston PFLAG.

What do we do?

The vision of the Livingston Pangburn Transgender Access Partnership (TAP),  is to increase access to information, services and support for ALL transgender young people and their families regardless of socioeconomic and educational status; ethnic, racial and religious identity; or geographic location. We recognize that these factors influence access in two ways: by mediating the amount of resources available and the likelihood of accessing those resources. This awareness guides our focus in partnering with other LBGTQQ-supportive organizations to both increase services available and reach out to under-served, disenfranchised transgender youth and their families. 


What are our goals for this campaign?

Our goal is to raise over $3,500 to support the work of TAP to make much needed information, services and support accessible to ALL transgender young people and their families regardless of where they live, their income, education, health status, religious or cultural heritage.  We know that there are thousands of transgender youth who don't have the access they need to believe in themselves, be supported by a network of caring and responsible peers and role models, and build productive, healthy and happy lives.

What have we done so far?

 Thus far, TAP has identified and helped fund the BodyImage4Justice initiative which is cosponsored by the Hispanic Black Gay Coalition of Boston.  BodyImage4Justice promotes positive self-image and self-esteem through yoga, fitness training and nutritional education for young trans* people in Boston.  With TAP support, gym memberships, workshop fees and supplies will be given to transgender young people who couldn't otherwise afford these health-building and self-affirming services.

What can you do?

With your support, TAP will continue funding those who give access to critical services to transgender youth and their families.

Thank you for your time and donation! If you have chosen not to donate money, please consider volunteering your time or services - email us at transgenderaccesspartnership@gmail.com for more information.

Like us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/LivingstonPangburnTAP

Email us at transgenderaccesspartnership@gmail.com

Find us at www.gbpflag.org/TAP

Follow us on Twitter @livtap

story:
Hey Family, We (Puma & David) have devoted the last 20 months to learning how to facilitate the Wake Up Experience (which was born from the Pachamama Alliance’s connection with the Achuar Tribe in Ecuador 19 years ago) at schools, organizations, festivals, and Universities to groups numbering over 60 participants! The foundation of this experience is changing the “dream” & story of the modern world which is based in separation and is fundamentally unsustainable - meaning that it is destroying Pachamama. Then we share the possibility of a new story based in interconnectivity and inter-beingness, and point to its roots in First Nation’s, Indigenous Cultures.

Over the past 2 years we've each found healing within native wisdom through our relationships with various wisdom keepers and elders. We have learned how to be in right relationship with ourselves, one another, and our planet. We have undergone ceremonial rites of passage that have helped us to better understand who we are, and why we're here on this planet - something that is missing from modern western culture and that leaves youth our age addicted & disempowered.

Most people today (and sadly, for most of our youth) spend their whole lives lost, wondering who they are and why they're here. We've found that through integrating Indigenous Wisdom into our lives we’ve been more capable of embodying and living from a worldview based in interconnectivity. We now know that it is our life’s mission to be of service to facilitating the collective shift from a worldview that is unsustainable to a worldview based in interconnectivity, interdependence, and sustainability.

We have been blessed with the opportunity to spend 6-weeks (Sept 26th - Nov 9th) in Peru studying and building relations with the Shipibo, Q’ero and Aymaran Cultures. We feel that it is important for us to further ground ourselves in tradition and ancient wisdom so that we can better be a beacon of light to our generation and generations to come through our work with Generation Waking Up & IAMLIFE - balancing the fruits of the modern world with the fruits of the indigenous world and protecting our one and only home! 

From Sept 26th - October 15th we will study with a Shipibo family of healers (see photos below) in Pucalpa, Peru, learning about traditional plant medicines and journeying deep in to the jungle to meet other tribes.  They create unique telas (tapestries) that embody medicine songs and give protection and we are offering these as perks so that you can directly support this family and our ability to study with them. Long term, the IAMLIFE Project will be supporting this family through selling their telas and other artwork via the IAMLIFE website and this is our intention for building ongoing, reciprocal relations. 

From October 19th - November 1st we will embark on a 14-day pilgrimage guided by two Wisdom Keepers from the Q'ero and Aymaran cultures and the Reviveolution Team to sacred sites around Peru and Bolivia, collaborating and strengthening the vision of Reviveolution: "To redefine "modern culture" as a global community which educates and inspires all present and future generations to maintain a lasting symbiotic relationship with each other and the living planet...To empower indigenous cultures, and all individuals in the world, to reconnect to our ancestral roots and walk in collective sustainable action as stewards of this Earth."  This pilgrimage is the first of many meetings to ground and nurture dynamic collaboration and reciprocity between the IAMLIFE Project and Reviveolution, including their longer-term vision of building an Inkan "Tawantinsuyo" ("the four united regions") Eco-Temple Sanctuary for Indigenous leaders to gather in spiritual practice to pass forth ancestral wisdom and traditional healing to all individuals of the present and future generations.

"Gate of the Gods" in Bolivia^
 

What We Need & What You Get

For this to be a reality, we need $3,000. This money will be going directly to the Wisdom Keepers that we will be staying with to support the preservation & integration of their wisdom and ways.

Perks: photos below

*4 medium and 3 large Shipibo telas (tapestries) - photos below*

*4 Wake Up Experiences - The Generation Waking Up Experience - called a “WakeUp” for short - is an interactive, multimedia workshop about the challenges & opportunities of our time, and inspires participants to take meaningful action toward a thriving, just, sustainable world.

*10 opportunities to Sponsor a Youth to attend "Gathering of the Ages" at the Ojai Foundation, a 3-day Intergenerational EQUINOX Celebration of Indigenous Wisdom in Contemporary Times


Large Telas (5 x 6ft)

(1)  


(2)


Medium Telas (4 x 4.75ft)

(1)

(2)

(3)

(4)


    The Impact

    You are supporting an ongoing, longterm, reciprocal relationship between North and South American Wisdom Traditions, helping to bridge the gap between the modern world and the indigenous world and supporting the transmission of this wisdom to the youth.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      We know that money is tight for many of us, and we totally get that. We ask that you please share this campaign within your networks - every single share opens the door for someone new to sponsor us! 

      Thank you for supporting this journey in whatever way you are able ~

      In Reverence, Love, Harmony, and Gratitude,

      ~Puma & David
