We now know that it is our life’s mission to be of service to facilitating the collective shift from a worldview that is unsustainable to a worldview based in interconnectivity, interdependence, and sustainability.
We have been blessed with the opportunity to spend 6-weeks (Sept 26th - Nov 9th) in Peru studying and building relations with the Shipibo, Q’ero and Aymaran Cultures. We feel that it is important for us to further ground ourselves in tradition and ancient wisdom so that we can better be a beacon of light to our generation and generations to come through our work with Generation Waking Up & IAMLIFE - balancing the fruits of the modern world with the fruits of the indigenous world and protecting our one and only home! 
From Sept 26th - October 15th we will study with a Shipibo family of healers (see photos below) in Pucalpa, Peru, learning about traditional plant medicines and journeying deep in to the jungle to meet other tribes.  They create unique telas (tapestries) that embody medicine songs and give protection and we are offering these as perks so that you can directly support this family and our ability to study with them. Long term, the IAMLIFE Project will be supporting this family through selling their telas and other artwork via the IAMLIFE website and this is our intention for building ongoing, reciprocal relations. 


From October 19th - November 1st we will embark on a 14-day pilgrimage guided by two Wisdom Keepers from the Q'ero and Aymaran cultures and the Reviveolution Team to sacred sites around Peru and Bolivia, collaborating and strengthening the vision of Reviveolution: "To redefine "modern culture" as a global community which educates and inspires all present and future generations to maintain a lasting symbiotic relationship with each other and the living planet...To empower indigenous cultures, and all individuals in the world, to reconnect to our ancestral roots and walk in collective sustainable action as stewards of this Earth."  This pilgrimage is the first of many meetings to ground and nurture dynamic collaboration and reciprocity between the IAMLIFE Project and Reviveolution, including their longer-term vision of building an Inkan "Tawantinsuyo" ("the four united regions") Eco-Temple Sanctuary for Indigenous leaders to gather in spiritual practice to pass forth ancestral wisdom and traditional healing to all individuals of the present and future generations.

"Gate of the Gods" in Bolivia^ 

What We Need & What You Get
For this to be a reality, we need $3,000. This money will be going directly to the Wisdom Keepers that we will be staying with to support the preservation & integration of their wisdom and ways.
Perks: photos below
*4 medium and 3 large Shipibo telas (tapestries) - photos below*
*4 Wake Up Experiences - The Generation Waking Up Experience - called a “WakeUp” for short - is an interactive, multimedia workshop about the challenges & opportunities of our time, and inspires participants to take meaningful action toward a thriving, just, sustainable world.
*10 opportunities to Sponsor a Youth to attend "Gathering of the Ages" at the Ojai Foundation, a 3-day Intergenerational EQUINOX Celebration of Indigenous Wisdom in Contemporary Times


Large Telas (5 x 6ft)(1)  



(2)


Medium Telas (4 x 4.75ft)(1)(2)
(3)(4)


  The Impact You are supporting an ongoing, longterm, reciprocal relationship between North and South American Wisdom Traditions, helping to bridge the gap between the modern world and the indigenous world and supporting the transmission of this wisdom to the youth.


  Other Ways You Can Help
We know that money is tight for many of us, and we totally get that. We ask that you please share this campaign within your networks - every single share opens the door for someone new to sponsor us! Thank you for supporting this journey in whatever way you are able ~In Reverence, Love, Harmony, and Gratitude,~Puma & David

story:
Hello!

My name is Solomon Abimaje, Coordinator/Director of "Fun African Poetic Expression For Kids" Project.  I am an African and a Graduate of Metallurgical and Material Science Engineering.

Growing up, I fell in love with cartoons, computers, acting, directing, video editing, in essence Multi Media. The “Sound of Music”, “Mary Popping's”, “Star Wars”, “Care bears”, “You can read”, “Voltron”.....and lots more induced child-like awe which grew to sensible adoration. This later created a strong desire to learn and educate myself on the fundamentals and basics of main stream Multi Media even while studying metallurgy. But that wasn't enough, I began to research online and watch tutorial videos, I even spent a substantial amount of money buying software to become well vast on the subject.

( Fig : Editing on Adobe After Effects Poem Title: Strength in small things.)

Funny thing is I actually didn't know what Metallurgy was until I got into the University. Long story short, in Africa parents don't usually approve of you studying anything that does not lead to a "Professional" career of some sort, Medicine, Pharmacy, Engineering and what not were the more prestigious options.

On graduation, from the University; knowing the way things are in my country, getting a Job with that Major was going to be next to impossible because the only place I could practice the profession had been shut down since the early 80's. So, I focused on Multi Media.

I set up a team of Four (4) graduates from different "weird" majors but was also into one form of video, music, press and general multimedia like me.

A Writer, An Artist/Matte painter and 2d/3d Animator, Director of Photography (DOP) and A VFX/Animator/Editor/Director..... We all are Mega Multi-tasking specialists... 


The Project: Fun African Poetic Expressions for Kids

I've always loved children; teaching, playing and even singing to them is a marvellous feeling. My drive is that they are the future. And growing up in Africa, I can attest to the fact that we are blessed with so much talent and untapped resources which would afford the world a great deal of virtue.

We want to make cartoons, children series and movies that will show the world what Africa has to offer.

Unlike what the Media says about Africa, hunger, corruption, religious crisis, savagery; Africa is a beautiful land...glorious and rich with wonderful wonders.....a land of diverse cultures, traditions and heritage that we want to help preserve and share with the world.

What better way than to pass them on and teach them to our kids in a fun and educative way?

We decided to partner with Dr. Odiniya, a retired Senior Official of the Federal Civil service of Nigeria to bring his book “The Power of Poetic Expressions” to life.

The book contains Nursery rhymes and Poems which reflect core values such as Happiness, Peace, Courage, Confidence, Sharing, Unity and Respect.

In this Project, we teach common and new African poems children that can relate to.

For example: The Colours of my bow:


Everything from Character design to composing of scores and voice overs was done in our little studio. We are planning and have started to train the local youth in the core basics of multimedia. This is our way of giving back to them. That way they can develop these talents from a young age.

In Africa, there has been a downward spiral in children’s educative content. Africa’s main stream media is focused mainly on Home movies and music videos which really don’t offer much or even little to the growth and development of children.


How You Can Help and What You Will Get

By helping us achieve this goal, you’ll be contributing not only in producing the DVD but also to a greater cause; training the youth in the community in animation, drama, design, art, music and even video editing.

That way will help and encourage them to learn how to express themselves through the above listed including Science and even learning from other cultures by meeting people from different parts of the world and making friends. An experience they will cherish for a lifetime.

We will also like to set up a network in the near future so that the voices of these talented youths and those that have interest in Nigeria and other parts of Africa can be heard and showcased to the whole world.


How Will the Funds Raised Be Used?

  • Paying talent fees. This includes writers, actors etc.
  • Research, translation into different African languages
  • Equipment/Software leasing and purchasing
  • Marketing
  • Development of a new website for the project 
  • Training up and hiring local animation talent 
  • Legal services
  • Financial services
  • Advertising services
  • Running overhead costs

We believe that even if the amount we want to raise is not reached, we can still use what has been raised to build and nurture the talents of these youths because only then can we increase in strength and number and then our voice will be heard even louder.

Investing in lives is what we believe in and we have taken a stand in our belief which is to level the playing field for those who have talent and don't have the means to improve and even showcase their work.

We appreciate your going through this short summary of what we are trying to achieve. We know that a lot of people might want to contribute in helping to build this future with us but cannot do so financially. However, you can help us by spreading the word and letting people know about our campaign.

Help share our page and like our video especially here on Indiegogo so that people can see and know what we stand for and where we are going. Thanks for your time.

Regards

Solomon Abimaje

story:
What is Soccer Info?

Soccer Info is a free WordPress plugin that lets you display the standings (ranking tables), upcoming fixtures and results of soccer (football) leagues from all over the World. It supports more than 550 leagues at the moment, for example: UEFA Champions League, Europa League, MLS, English Premier League, La Liga (Spanish Primera Division) and leagues from South America, Africa and Asia.

This plugin is very popular among the site owners blogging about soccer, it has already over 13,500 downloads from WordPress.org

Who is behind this project?

My name is Szilard Mihaly, I am a freelance web designer and developer and an amateur football (soccer) player. 

The idea of creating the first version of Soccer Info came during the development of a project that I worked on few years ago. I had to realize that there wasn't any similar plugins on the WordPress.org at that time, so I decided to create one.

I developed the plugin in my free time and shared it with the WordPress community for FREE. I still update the plugin when I have time for it.

But I want to lift this plugin to the next level

The next step would be to create Soccer Info 2.0 that has new features that was already asked by more individuals before.

New features:

  • Ability of adding the teams' logos
  • Ability of changing the default name of the teams
  • Possibility to create individual page for the teams or adding external link to the official site of the team
  • Adding advanced styling options
  • other new features may come up during the development

What I need?

I need "only" TIME... and we all know: "time is money" 

... but it is getting harder and harder to get enough time for this because I have to work and feed my family just like anyone else does. 

Just like You!

My idea to solve this "time and family feeding issue" is to take 2 months off and spend it on the creation of the new plugin.

  • I will need $2.400 to pay my bills/rent/food/etc during the development
  • $1.100 to pay the VPS hosting for the next 1 year
  • All dollars above the goal will be used on ads to spread the word of the new version of the plugin.

    Other ways you can Help

    It may happen that you can't afford to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help me. You can spread the words!

    • Share my idea of Soccer Info 2.0 and make some noise about my campaign.
    • Please use the sharing tools of Indiegogo!

    Thank you for reading.

    I hope you will be among my plugin's contributors soon.

    Sincerely,

    Szilard

story: Hi, we’re Fund Our Field-Trips. We are three middle school students from an Arizona school. We need money to fund our field-trips, special events, and other great activities. We're planning to sell Stories, Cookies, Plushies, Dubstep, and Origami. But we need your help! We would like to raise $750 to cover the cost of several immersion trips, special events, and other things. The reason that we would like the money that you can gladly donate, is because these special field studies will help us learn, not just in school but also out of school, in the world. We’re offering these special perks if you don’t just want to donate. Your contribution will help us, and you will receive these perks. Please donate to our fundraiser. Thank you so much!!!

story:
In July 2013, a diverse group of 21 Metro employees attended Zappos' Boot Camp to learn about their culture.  Within the first hour, we were WOW’ed in many unforgettable ways.  (We won't give examples and spoil the surprise in case you get to attend!)  But one thing we CAN share - it was very clear, in all that they do, that their employees are their NUMBER 1 focus!  This came through loud and clear in their customer service, and the reputation Zappos has maintained over the years.

We've taken that concept back to our Department in a way that fits our culture, mission and values, and created the WOW! Team. The Team's mission is to increase employee recognition and engagement, and pay it forward through volunteerism to each other and the community.  Since attending the three-day Boot Camp, the WOW! Team has grown to well over 100 committed members and growing.  

Studies have shown that employees who feel appreciated and are engaged with their work and with each other will have lower turnover, less absenteeism and tardiness, and increased productivity.  This translates to reduced hiring, training and retention costs, as well as better service to the people we serve - YOU, the Las Vegas community!

The WOW! Team provides education, training, ideas and opportunities to all Department members on how to recognize and appreciate their employees and each other.  Although this does happen on its own, we all know that law enforcement agencies have increasingly significant and inherently dangerous issues to deal with in today's times, which absorb the overwhelming majority of our time and resources, and rightfully so.  The WOW! Team provides these recognition and engagement programs and opportunities, freeing up others' time to handle those serious public safety issues to keep you safe.

The WOW! Team also provides opportunities to give back to each other and the community through volunteerism.  This has included drives for needed items in the community, team walk/run events, etc., for such organizations as Goodie Two Shoes, Opportunity Village, Three Square, and the Nevada Partnership for Homeless Youth.  Not only are we helping the community that we serve, but this also fulfills a need for a greater sense of balance and purpose felt by our employees.

As with any program, providing quality training and opportunities can range in cost. The WOW! Team continues to invest in the Las Vegas community through investing in the Department's employees.  Up until now, our costs have been absorbed by our dedicated Team members, but this has limited our ability to expand to reach more employees.  We are in dire need of donations and that's where we’re hoping YOU will come in!  

To really do this right and create a culture where employees truly feel more valued and appreciated for all of their hard work and self-sacrifice, we would greatly appreciate your donation, no matter how small. Your partnership will grow our programs and will let our employees know, in a WOW way, how much our community supports the work of the men and women of Metro.  

We hope you will support us.  Thank you for considering our case.

story:
If you are a UK Taxpayer and would like to claim an extra 25% from your donation via gift aid please email us on giftaid@alfatihaglobal.com for a gift aid form.


Al Fatiha Global is committed to helping humaity, with atrocities and humanitarian crisises increasing globally, we have an ethos to not only restore humanity but to also bring happiness and peace to those who desperately need it through the implementation of our projects, delivering food packages, viral medication and medical resources and helping schools/children re-build their lives.


We work tirelessly to ensure your donations reach those in need. We all have a 'hands on' approach to personally deliver the aid when possible, we actively work together towards a better future for everyone.


We view this mission as an obligation upon us to help those whose circumstances have left them in a vulnerable position and we endeavour to fulfil our promises to the best of our abilities, God willing..

story: Six years ago, I was looking to volunteer at an NGO in India over the summer, as I was already in the country for family reasons. My search led me to Uttam and Shobha Kumar, two humble and passionate people that were running a small childrens' home called "Spandana", on the outskirts of Hyderabad. The story of Spandana started when Uttam and Shobha came across a mentally challenged 11-year old girl sleeping on the streets, surviving on chapati's and water that an auto rickshaw driver would share with her every day. Uttam and Shobha asked around but no one claimed any responsibility of this girl; she was completely abandoned. They decided to take responsibility for her. After weeks of caring for her, making sure she rested, ate well, and improved in condition, they placed her in a center for mentally challenged children. But the experience left them with a sense of duty, that they somehow needed to continue opening up their home to children that were abandoned, or children whose innocence was compromised by disturbing upbringings. Thus began Spandana. For years, Uttam and Shobha have been welcoming more children as they have been able- orphans, semi-orphans, abandoned children, and children from troubling backgrounds. Now there are 50 children under the complete care of Spandana - 25 girls and 25 boys, aged 4-16 years old. Uttam and Shobha - one couple - have taken full responsibility for 50 kids, and have assumed the position of being parents to every single one of these children. In spending even a day at the home, anyone can easily see how Uttam and Shobha take serious care of their kids, in every aspect, providing them with a healthy and love-filled childhood that is so very different than their pasts. As Uttam and Shobha have made this commitment among themselves to realize their duty, for changing the trajectory of many children's' lives, I've made a similar commitment to help Spandana become financially secure, and to help Uttam and Shobha be in a position to welcome more needy children. They want to be able to impact more children, but they are severely financially restrained. Spandana is restrained. Uttam and Shobha are only two people, and as they are running the organization, managing all the logistics and daily errands, dealing with the children's health and education needs, providing personal counseling to each kid, amongst a ton of other jobs required by this work... they simply do not have the bandwidth to secure the funds that they need for these kids. However, a little can go a long way at Spandana, and on this Christmas season, I'd like to invite anyone interested to play a role in Uttam and Shobha's mission with these kids for 2015. I basically moved into Spandana and I have become like family with everyone at the home. As you'd fight for your family, I am too. Uttam and Shobha haven't been able to raise the funds needed to cover all the kids' schooling for the 2015-2016 year. I'm inviting you to play a small role in this, whatever you can, whatever you want. The education costs for each kid at Spandana, including materials and notebooks, is $80 USD per year. In addition, Uttam and Shobha have been hoping to set the kids on a nutritious diet, including one glass of milk daily, and a few eggs a week, for each of their kids. But the costs of milk and eggs this regularly for 50 kids are too high for their current budget, so they've had to sparse out this nutrition. Again, I'd like to provide the opportunity to play a role here. The groceries for Spandana costs around $90 USD per week, for the entirety of the home. Until I can get some long-term donors and partnerships in place, I'm pushing for my little brothers and sisters over at Spandana to eat well and hearty every day. You can be 100% certain that 100% of your donations will go directly to the schooling and groceries for the kids at Spandana. This campaign is about relationships and care. You don't know these children, and they don't know you, but your futures may be tied; in offering a helping hand, you're offering a relationship of love and support to someone that may take your hand and truly appreciate it. To me, that's what Christmas has always been about, and I'm sure that you may feel the same way too. Do please pass on any questions or ideas to me, Anjali at anjalidaryanani22@gmail.com

Uttam and Shobha asked around but no one claimed any responsibility of this girl; she was completely abandoned. They decided to take responsibility for her. After weeks of caring for her, making sure she rested, ate well, and improved in condition, they placed her in a center for mentally challenged children. But the experience left them with a sense of duty, that they somehow needed to continue opening up their home to children that were abandoned, or children whose innocence was compromised by disturbing upbringings. Thus began Spandana. For years, Uttam and Shobha have been welcoming more children as they have been able- orphans, semi-orphans, abandoned children, and children from troubling backgrounds. Now there are 50 children under the complete care of Spandana - 25 girls and 25 boys, aged 4-16 years old. Uttam and Shobha - one couple - have taken full responsibility for 50 kids, and have assumed the position of being parents to every single one of these children. In spending even a day at the home, anyone can easily see how Uttam and Shobha take serious care of their kids, in every aspect, providing them with a healthy and love-filled childhood that is so very different than their pasts. As Uttam and Shobha have made this commitment among themselves to realize their duty, for changing the trajectory of many children's' lives, I've made a similar commitment to help Spandana become financially secure, and to help Uttam and Shobha be in a position to welcome more needy children. They want to be able to impact more children, but they are severely financially restrained. Spandana is restrained. Uttam and Shobha are only two people, and as they are running the organization, managing all the logistics and daily errands, dealing with the children's health and education needs, providing personal counseling to each kid, amongst a ton of other jobs required by this work... they simply do not have the bandwidth to secure the funds that they need for these kids. However, a little can go a long way at Spandana, and on this Christmas season, I'd like to invite anyone interested to play a role in Uttam and Shobha's mission with these kids for 2015. I basically moved into Spandana and I have become like family with everyone at the home. As you'd fight for your family, I am too. Uttam and Shobha haven't been able to raise the funds needed to cover all the kids' schooling for the 2015-2016 year. I'm inviting you to play a small role in this, whatever you can, whatever you want. The education costs for each kid at Spandana, including materials and notebooks, is $80 USD per year. In addition, Uttam and Shobha have been hoping to set the kids on a nutritious diet, including one glass of milk daily, and a few eggs a week, for each of their kids. But the costs of milk and eggs this regularly for 50 kids are too high for their current budget, so they've had to sparse out this nutrition. Again, I'd like to provide the opportunity to play a role here. The groceries for Spandana costs around $90 USD per week, for the entirety of the home. Until I can get some long-term donors and partnerships in place, I'm pushing for my little brothers and sisters over at Spandana to eat well and hearty every day. You can be 100% certain that 100% of your donations will go directly to the schooling and groceries for the kids at Spandana. This campaign is about relationships and care. You don't know these children, and they don't know you, but your futures may be tied; in offering a helping hand, you're offering a relationship of love and support to someone that may take your hand and truly appreciate it. To me, that's what Christmas has always been about, and I'm sure that you may feel the same way too. Do please pass on any questions or ideas to me, Anjali at anjalidaryanani22@gmail.com

story:
Introducing a New Technology Magazine

Hi, I'm Audrey! I'm the editor of The Recompiler, a new magazine about deepening our knowledge of technology in a fun, participatory way. I've been building free/open source software, community-based technology education, and print and digital media throughout my career, and now I'm ready to bring it all together into an awesome new project.

The Recompiler will invite writers and artists who work and play with technology to share what they know: how do things work? who builds what? how much can we take apart, and what will it look like to rebuild our technology and make it better? We'll do this through a quarterly print and online magazine. As a subscriber, you will be a part of our learning community.

Your contributions will pay for the writing, illustration, editing, and publishing costs of our first issue in Summer 2015. The Recompiler is especially focused on sharing the work of underrepresented groups, including women, people of color, people with disabilities, queer, genderqueer, and trans people. Your contribution supports these groups in sharing their technical work, knowledge, and skills.

What's the Plan?

The Recompiler will publish quarterly print issues, and at least four companion online issues each year. In order to do this, we need to pay for writers, artists, editing, print design, web design, and for printing and shipping the magazine to you. Your contribution will go toward all these costs so we can get our first issue out the door.

You have two annual subscription options: a full print subscription, one issue per quarter, or online-only preview access to the website articles. I love print magazines: you can hold them, share them, write on them, or cut them apart. They’re accessible even when you don’t have internet or power nearby. But digital text is accessible in different ways, allowing for screen readers, cutting & pasting examples, and sending links to friends. So we’re doing both.

You can choose additional perks, like a gift subscription for a friend, or tickets to our launch party in June, or you can participate in our first issue by contributing a question to the advice column (you will get an answer!) We’re also commissioning a series of hand-knit custom-designed Recompiler hats to offer subscribers who contribute $500 and up (see the artist’s other work).

A Magazine About...

We're excited about sharing our knowledge, bridging gaps, and supporting the full diversity of participants in technology. Each issue will have tutorials, discussion, criticism, and analysis designed to help us:

  • grow our technology skills
  • understand the full stack, from user to hardware
  • build better technical and social infrastructure
  • learn more about areas of technology that have a deep impact on what we can or can’t do, like systems, networks, security, and other back-end software
  • create sustainable, welcoming communities

Risks & Challenges

While I have experience with writing, editing, and publishing on a smaller scale, the scope of this project is larger than I’ve attempted before in this context. I intend to use the experience I have with other community-focused tech projects, such as Open Source Bridge and Calagator, to help guide me and keep me organized. I also have a great network of colleagues to advise me and provide support.

If we don't reach our goal, the first issue may need to be scaled back or delayed until we have enough subscribers to support it. Contributing now helps us bring you the full level of articles, tutorials, and other content as planned.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't subscribe today, tell your colleagues and friends. Also be sure to check out our Call for Contributors for Issue 1. Spread the word!

story:
What is Ag Week?

Purdue Ag Week is a campus-wide initiative at Purdue University that encourages meaningful peer-to-peer conversations about agriculture. Over 25 College of Agriculture student clubs inspire others to See What Ag Gives by hosting interactive events across campus. In addition to club events, a student-led planning committee organizes the club participation as well as hosts three events based on educational, philanthropy and community goals.

When is it and where is it?

Purdue Ag Week will take place Sunday April 12 – Friday, April 17. It will take place all over the Purdue University Campus.

What are Ag Clubs Hosting?

  • Milk Monday—Free grilled cheese along with facts about the dairy industry

  • Pet-A-Kid—A goat kid, that is!

  • Farmer’s Breakfast— Buy breakfast and learn where food comes from

  • Farmer 5K – Grab your best farmer costume and run in a 5K

  • Ag Jeopardy – answer questions correct and you get free beef jerky

What else is going on during Ag Week?

The student planning committee behind Purdue Ag Week, the Task Force, is sponsoring three special events

  1. The first is a food-packing event, Hammer Down Hunger.  Last year at Hammer Down Hunger, members of the Purdue community packed over 57,000 meals for schoolchildren in Haiti.  At this year’s event, our goal is to pack 70,000 meals!

  2. The second is an Oxfam Hunger Banquet—a unique dinner experience where Purdue campus leaders will learn about the effects of global hunger and hear a keynote address from Libby Crimmings of the World Food Prize Foundation.

  3. The third event is a Celebration of Agriculture, a social event where students can join together in community to continue conversations about agriculture.

How can you help?

As a student-organized group, we have the challenge of securing enough funds to create a thorough message with a lasting impact on campus. With the help of funding our effectiveness as an agriculture advocacy initiative can dramatically improve. On behalf of the Purdue Ag Week Task Force, we are asking for your help to fund Purdue Ag Week.

What do I get if I give?

  • Hand written thank-you note

  • Daily email updates from the Ag Task Force during Ag Week

  • Opportunity to be recognized as an official Purdue College of Agriculture donor

story:
Short Summary

I taught English to Speakers of Other Languages from 1998 to 2013. I wrote a dissertation on attitudes towards learning English among rural SE Kenyan Maasai adults as part of my MA in TESOL and Applied Linguistics in 2009. The findings showed overwhelmingly that people need to learn English to equip them to withstand the current environmental and economic changes that are taking place. With the decline of pastoralism, people need to diversify the ways in which they earn a living. Women in particular need English to be able to communicate with the tourists who visit their villages to buy their hand-crafted jewellery. I promised the community that I would go back to teach some taster basic English classes to the women, and I will be going from 2-15 June this year. This campaign is important to me because I am a woman who cares about other women. Contributing will make a small difference to the lives of the women in a poor rural community. This is just the first step in a campaign that I hope will grow over the long-term to become an established adult education programme in Kimana.   

What We Need & What You Get

  • I need 8 textbooks, 1 teacher's book (plus postage and packaging to Kenya), a white board, markers, a white board eraser, exercise books, pens, pencils, erasers and pencil sharpeners. I also need to give a gratuity to my driver/guide/interpreter.
  • Perks for now will include regular updates on my Facebook page (Maasai Women's Foundation) and my future Wordpress site. There will be opportunities to sponsor a learner and to volunteer in Kenya later on. 
  • If I don't reach my entire goal, the funds will go on purchasing as much as I can of what I have listed above.

The Impact

  • The Kenyan Maasai community have always been underprivileged, yet the women are proactively looking for ways to enable them to survive and prosper. They want to adapt, innovate and embrace new opportunities.
  • I previously fundraised successfully for an educational project in Guayaquil, Ecuador.
  • Being able to speaking a language that we take for granted could change the lives of an entire family. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about my campaign!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Why Hawai'i?

In 2005, Youth Speaks Hawai'i began sending a team annually to Brave New Voices, an international youth slam poetry festival. Since 2007, the team has made the semifinal stage of competition. In 2008 and 2009, Hawai'i won back-to-back international titles. In 2010, 2011 & 2012, Hawai'i followed up the titles with more semifinal appearances.

Last year, Team Hawai'i was unable to compete at Brave New Voices because of insufficient funds. This year, you have the opportunity to contribute to help Team Hawai'i get to competition in Philadelphia in July.

Your contribution will:

  • Help four talented young women share their stories and connect with other youth from around the nation and world.
  • Bring voices from Hawai'i to an international festival.
  • Reward the incredible effort of the team which has spent months practicing for competition.

The Team


Malialina Derden is a senior at Farrington High School and the president of the FHS Poetry Club. In 2011 and 2013 her poetry club took first place in Youth Speaks Hawaii's Interscholastic poetry slam. She enjoys working with all kinds of people. Malialina is now an intern for Hawaii Women in Filmmaking, a four year ally in her schools Gay- Straight Alliance, and a volunteer for the Mr. Sister Drag Show. She believes that there is nothing more important then connecting with the people who are around you. She hopes to continue meeting new people, hearing their stories, and developing connections that will last a life time.

Sarah is a junior at Farrington High School. She has participated in FHS poetry club 2013 and placed 1st at Youth Speaks Hawaii's Interscholastic poetry slam. She loves playing music, writing poetry, and chilling with her cat.

Tianzhen is an ardent follower of Jesus and self-proclaimed enthusiast of art. A senior at Kaiser high school, Tianzhen presides as the President of Kaiser’s Slam Poetry club and Co-editor in Chief of The Cougar Connection newspaper. Highly fond of any and all forms of art, whether it be poetry, music, visual, theater, fashion, photography, film or literature, Tianzhen loves commending, connecting with and learning from artists across disciplines. As a musician and poet, Tianzhen hopes to further the legacy of artists she admires by creating works that are a salt and light to her audience.

Joanna Gordon is a poet that dwells in the reformed swamplands of Hawaii Kai as a graduate of Kaiser High School and studies English at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. She’s involved with a local youth poetry organization Pacific Tongues and has competed as both poet and coach for various Pacific Tongues events. She was a member of First Wave Hip Hop Theatre Ensemble at the University of Wisconsin, and has co-written and performed in a collaborative production called “Welcome Mat at Capacity” at First Wave’s annual LineBreaks festival. Since being home, Joanna’s writing reflects the many voices of the women she has encountered. She uses them to heal, relate, and shed light upon the expectations and stereotypes bestowed upon women. She also enjoys cereal.

Coaches

Lyz Soto is Co-founder of Pacific Tongues and between 2008 and 2012 she was the Executive Director of Youth Speaks Hawaiʻi. She has worked as the head coach of the Youth Speaks Hawaiʻi Slam Team from 2008 until 2012 and she is currently working towards a PhD at University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa, where she also teaches English. She has performed in Hawaiʻi and across the continental United States. She has also had the honor of traveling with Youth Speaks Hawaiʻi alumni to Aotearoa, where she had the great pleasure of performing with the South Auckland Poets Collective. Her chapbook, Eulogies, was published in 2010 by TinFish Press.

Jocelyn Ng is a Hawai'i based poet, public school educator, and poetry facilitator. She has been a member of seven national slam teams. She is a 2x Brave New Voices Champion, a 2011 CUPSI 'Best of the Rest' performer, and was a member of the 2013 InkSlam Championship team in Los Angeles. As a graduate from the University of San Francisco with a bachelor's degree in English Literature, she has conducted poetry workshops throughout schools in California and Hawai'i.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Please share this campaign with all your social networks!

story:
A new way to read books and tablets? It’s about time! Mükava (Mū kå vå) is the world’s first ergonomic reading table.

The Project

We noticed during our research that as a result of trying to read a book, a tablet or phone for a prolonged period of time, many people develop pain in their neck and wrists. The phenomena of ‘Tech Neck’ and 'Ipad Wrist' are getting a lot of coverage in the press these days. As a result of this pain we read less or cannot work as long as we’d like to with our tablets.

After talking with many people who use tablet holders, we wanted to address four important points that they find dissatisfying about using the tablet holders currently on the market:

• Most tablet holders take time and can be difficult to assemble

• It takes time to swap out tablets with the current designs

• Concern that today's tablet holder won’t be able to hold future tablets

• When it’s not being used, a tablet holder just takes up space

Great design can add to the décor of any home or office. We believe that there is no need to chose between beautiful design and functionality. We have tried to address these points with a new kind of tool that we hope you will enjoy; Mükava and Mükava For Monitor Arm.

Mükava is designed to change the way we interact with all the things that we read or browse our tablets. It’s a new category of furniture!

Here are some of the key features:

Mükava comes ready to go out of the box. This means its the perfect gift to send to someone who suffering from pain from prolonged tablet use without having to worry about having to set it up for them.

Mükava is both a side table and a reading table. When you are finished using Mükava, it folds into a side table. Mükava’s stand system allows for Mükava to be adjusted to more than 12 different positions to accommodate how you read or watch your table devices. We have filed for four patents because of the breakthrough technology included in this product!

Mükava Premium (as show above) comes in an all brushed stainless steel finish for both the stand and the reading surface.  It's perfect also for reading or watching a movie in bed!

Mükava Premium comes with a brushed steel stand and a brushed steel appearance on the reading surface while Mükava comes with a white stand and either a white or birch wood finish for the reading surface.

Mükava's reading surface is made with materials to keep it hygienic and it's super easy to clean with standard household cleaners.

With the proprietary Mükava Pad, you can put safely put any tablet or phone on Mükava in just seconds and swap out devices easily! Each Mükava comes with three (3) Mükava Pads so that everyone in the house can keep theirs on their device, ready to use with the family Mükava.

USB Charging Ports & Removable USB Light

Mükava's 2 USB charging ports allow you to charge your tablet and use the USB reading light simultaneously! Mükava's power adapter is rated at 100-240V, 50-60 Hz input power and 5 volts, 4 amps of output power making it useful anywhere in the world.

The removable USB light has one touch control for on and off as well to adjust the light levels.

Book Bands and Document Pebbles

Document Pebbles are stored neatly in the back of Mükava and are used for securing documents on the surface of Mükava while working in the office or in the kitchen.

To hold traditional books, we include adjustable book bands for traditional books and magazines so that people of all ages can read hands-free. 

Mükava Premium and Mükava for Monitor Arm

We created a monitor arm version of Mükava that fits onto any standard monitor arm equipped with a VISA plate.

Mükava for Monitor Arm is useful for different work places like an office or kitchen where the full stand version is not convenient. Use Mükava for Monitor Arm to facilitate work on documents or refer to your tablet while using your computer. In the kitchen, Mükava for Monitor Arm can hold recipes, cookbooks or help you to watch a Youtube cooking show on your tablet allowing you to start and stop as you need to.

Mükava for Monitor Arm offers charging capabilities if the requisite electrical cables are included with your monitor arm and plugged in. The reading head colors are the same as the reading head for the stand version.

For more information about Mükava and Mükava for Monitor Arm check out our website http://www.mukava-tables.com/shop/ .

Our Company

Our Company (The Project for Adult Literacy and Schools, LLC) is an American company and a social enterprise. We are focused on two important causes that are important to us; adult illiteracy in America and education for homeless children.

We have chosen to bring awareness about adult literacy through our association with the Literacy Volunteers of Washington County in Westerly, Rhode Island. 10% of the profits from the sales of Mükava products will go towards supporting this program.

We have also partnered with the good folks at the Sekolah Pondok Domba (School of the Little Lambs) in Jakarta, Indonesia to build school classrooms and to help the homeless children living in the city to go to school so that they can escape poverty. 10% from the profits from the sales of Mükava products will go directly towards helping these children through this program.

More information about our involvement in these programs, check out our website http://www.mukava-tables.com/sekolah-pondok-domba/ and http://www.mukava-tables.com/literacy-volunteers-of-washington-county/. To learn more about our company, see http://www.mukava-tables.com.

What’s next?

The proceeds from this Kickstarter project will go towards purchasing the necessary tooling and components to build our first units and to help with getting the word out about Mükava through social media. We are working through the whole supplier selection process and finding all the right sub-suppliers who can deliver the parts with the precision we need to make Mükava as awesome as can be. The dates below are our working timeframe and are approximations based on what we know today:

2014

• July / August: Final prototypes are finished and are being tested to lifetime requirements and for last minute improvements to the product.

• September / October / November: Supplier is chosen and tooling is fabricated.

• December: First units are built from early tooling parts and checked for performance. First ‘T3’ units are tested with typical consumers around the world for testing and feedback before we start production. Last minute adjustments are made. Components are ordered.

2015

• January/February/ March: Production starts. First units are shipped to our Kickstarter backers around the world in March with all units should be delivered to our backers by the end of April 2015. http://www.mukava-tables.com/shop/

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

No one wants to see a good idea executed poorly and we have waited until now to bring this project to Kickstarter so that we could be sure that it would happen. Our experienced team has the skill sets to manage the risks to this project as much as possible both before an after we open our tooling. We have worked extremely hard to ready this product for Kickstarter and full-scale manufacturing and fulfillment, and here are the risks that I see:

MANUFACTURING: Creating the tooling to manufacture a product like Mükava requires working with suppliers who can deliver parts to our exacting standards consistently. To minimize that possibility of making mistakes we're working with tooling manufacturers and a production partner with a demonstrated dedication to quality.

PRODUCT ADJUSTMENTS: As Mükava gets ready for production, there will likely be some minor adjustments to improve the final product. The prototypes made to date are made to test and refine the product and allow us to incorporate our adjustments and those suggested by experienced manufacturing partners. All adjustments will be made for a better end user experience and these improvements will be both noted in the project updates and on the product pages of our website: http://www.mukava-tables.com/shop/ and our Kickstarter blog : http://www.mukava-tables.com/kickstarter/.

FULFILLMENT: Sometimes things go awry that can’t be planned for and there will no doubt be some surprises along the road, but any obstacle will be addressed by combining our internal knowledge with external expertise, and an overall goal of making the best possible product for you.

Any pledge amount brings us one step closer to our goal. Help us make Mükava the a success by pledging what you can or by helping us spread the word by sharing our page.

Ask a question info@mukava-tables.com

Thanks,

Tom
story_txt:
A new way to read books and tablets? It’s about time!

Mükava (Mū kå vå) is the world’s first ergonomic reading table.The ProjectWe noticed during our research that as a 
result of trying to read a book, a tablet or phone for a prolonged 
period of time, many people develop pain in their neck and wrists.  The 
phenomena of ‘Tech Neck’ and 'Ipad Wrist' are getting a lot of coverage 
in the press these days.  As a result of this pain we read less or 
cannot work as long as we’d like to with our tablets. After 
talking with many people who use tablet holders, we wanted to address 
four important points that they find dissatisfying about using the 
tablet holders currently on the market: • Most tablet holders take time and can be difficult to assemble
•	It takes time to swap out tablets with the current designs•	Concern that today's tablet holder won’t be able to hold future tablets 
•	When it’s not being used, a tablet holder just takes up spaceGreat
 design can add to the décor of any home or office. We believe that 
there is no need to chose between beautiful design and functionality. We
 have tried to address these points with a new kind of tool that we hope
 you will enjoy; Mükava and Mükava For Monitor Arm.Mükava
 is designed to change the way we interact with all the things that we 
read or browse our tablets. It’s a new category of furniture!Here are some of the key features:Mükava comes ready to go out of the box. This means its the perfect gift
 to send to someone who suffering from pain from prolonged tablet use 
without having to worry about having to set it up for them.Mükava is both a side table and a reading table. When you are finished 
using Mükava, it folds into a side table. Mükava’s stand system allows 
for Mükava to be adjusted to more 
than 12 different positions to accommodate how you read or watch your 
table devices. We have filed for four patents because of the 
breakthrough technology included in this product!Mükava Premium (as show above) comes in an all brushed stainless steel 
finish for both the stand and the reading surface.  It's perfect also 
for reading or watching a movie in bed!Mükava Premium comes with a brushed steel stand and a brushed steel appearance on the reading surface while Mükava comes with a white stand and either a white or birch wood finish for the reading surface.Mükava's reading surface is made with materials to keep it hygienic 
and it's super easy to clean with standard household cleaners.With
 the proprietary Mükava Pad, you can put safely put any tablet or phone 
on Mükava in just seconds and swap out devices easily! Each Mükava comes
 with three (3) Mükava Pads so that everyone in the house can keep 
theirs on their device, ready to use with the family Mükava.USB Charging Ports & Removable USB Light
Mükava's 2 USB charging ports allow you to charge your tablet and use
 the USB reading light simultaneously! Mükava's power adapter is rated 
at 100-240V, 50-60 Hz input power and 5 volts, 4 amps of output power 
making it useful anywhere in the world.The removable USB light has one touch control for on and off as well to adjust the light levels.

Book Bands and Document PebblesDocument Pebbles are stored neatly in the back of Mükava and are used 
for securing documents on the surface of Mükava while working in the 
office or in the kitchen.To hold traditional books, we include adjustable book bands for 
traditional books and magazines so that people of all ages can read 
hands-free. Mükava Premium and Mükava for Monitor ArmWe created a monitor arm version of Mükava that fits onto any standard monitor arm equipped with a VISA plate.Mükava
 for Monitor Arm is useful for different work places like an office or 
kitchen where the full stand version is not convenient. Use Mükava for 
Monitor Arm to facilitate work on documents or refer to your tablet 
while using your computer. In the kitchen, Mükava for Monitor Arm can 
hold recipes, cookbooks or help you to watch a Youtube cooking show on 
your tablet allowing you to start and stop as you need to.Mükava 
for Monitor Arm offers charging capabilities if the requisite electrical
 cables are included with your monitor arm and plugged in. The reading 
head colors are the same as the reading head for the stand version.For more information about Mükava and Mükava for Monitor Arm check out our website http://www.mukava-tables.com/shop/ . Our CompanyOur Company (The Project for Adult Literacy and Schools, LLC)
 is an American company and a social enterprise. We are focused on two 
important causes that are important to us; adult illiteracy in America 
and education for homeless children. We have chosen to bring 
awareness about adult literacy through our association with the Literacy
 Volunteers of Washington County in Westerly, Rhode Island. 10% of the 
profits from the sales of Mükava products will go towards supporting 
this program. We have also partnered with the good folks at the 
Sekolah Pondok Domba (School of the Little Lambs) in Jakarta, Indonesia 
to build school classrooms and to help the homeless children living in 
the city to go to school so that they can escape poverty. 10% from the 
profits from the sales of Mükava products will go directly towards 
helping these children through this program.More information about our involvement in these programs, check out our website http://www.mukava-tables.com/sekolah-pondok-domba/ and http://www.mukava-tables.com/literacy-volunteers-of-washington-county/. To learn more about our company, see http://www.mukava-tables.com.What’s next?The proceeds from this Kickstarter project will go
 towards purchasing the necessary tooling and components to build our 
first units and to help with getting the word out about Mükava through 
social media. We are working through the whole supplier selection 
process and finding all the right sub-suppliers who can deliver the 
parts with the precision we need to make Mükava as awesome as can be. 
The dates below are our working timeframe and are approximations based 
on what we know today:2014•	July / August: Final 
prototypes are finished and are being tested to lifetime requirements 
and for last minute improvements to the product.•	September / October / November: Supplier is chosen and tooling is fabricated.•
 December: First units are built from early tooling parts and checked 
for performance. First ‘T3’ units are tested with typical consumers 
around the world for testing and feedback before we start production. 
Last minute adjustments are made. Components are ordered.2015•
	January/February/ March: Production starts. First units are shipped to 
our Kickstarter backers around the world in March with all units should 
be delivered to our backers by the end of April 2015. 
http://www.mukava-tables.com/shop/RISKS AND CHALLENGESNo one wants to see a good idea executed poorly and we have waited 
until now to bring this project to Kickstarter so that we could be sure 
that it would happen. Our experienced team has the skill sets to manage

expertise, and an overall goal of making the best possible product for 
you.

the word by sharing our page.

Thanks,

story:
Dear Education & Art Supporters:

      Uncle Sam’s Lady (USL) will be the main character of a monthly students (Comics) bilingual newsletter or magazine distributed in elementary, secondary schools and or some public places. The main goal and purpose is to make a positive addition to the U.S. educational curriculum focusing on topics and messages to strength students’ academic and personal development. Also its content would support teacher’s classroom and parenting management.    
Better 

Persons would 

Better S

tudents, B

etter Professionals, and 

G

reat C

itizens.” (USL)

The 1st Student’s Superhero will promote respect, kindness, good manners, sensitivity, appreciation toward himself, classmates, family, community members, disadvantage people, and mother's nature.  There are children or teens at homes with single mothers, divorced couples, both parents working, and or economic difficulties in  need of be oriented and supported.
As humanitarian and pacifist character USL wants to encourage and to teach students better ways to overcome  self destructive attitudes and negative habits. Defeating enemies like low-self esteem, low motivation, lack of concentration, anger, and bullying. Moreover, she remarks the importance of solving personal and social conflicts without being aggressive or violent.
                  “Never against You…Never against Others.” (USL) 
USL HAS FRIENDS AROUND THE WORLD & BEYOND !
This comics character is able to travel to other continents, space and through time contacting different friends and superheroes, even from ancient cultures, promoting multicultural values. Some USL friends are an AFRICAN Wizard, and an EGYPTIAN Magician, EARTHQUAKE from the Middle East, the Twin Karate CHINESE Masters, the SUN Warrior APOLLO (the LIGHT"), “Dama" MESTIZA from Latin America, RAINBOW Women from the Cosmos, the GREEK Goddess Νίκη (Victoria), the European VIKING, the Australian ANZAC, the ABORIGINAL Warrior, PENGUIN MAN from Antarctica, and the HOT MUSICAL Lady from Pangea (The Supercontinent). Finally, the NIGHT Fancy Lady from any street in any country of the world.
 Why it is important your support to Uncle’s Sam Lady and to work shoulder to shoulder with her or to be part of her team?
When traditionally our schools watch mainly over the improvement of academic curriculum, raising test scores, and graduation rates. It is also crucial to support and to strength their inner superheroes too. The student as a person, and human being. Considering that children are the future of this country, and our entire planet.   
At first, more than  1 million students will benefit with the USL Civics and Social Studies program. 
Statistics
According to the latest report from the National Center for Education Statistics, there were about 98,300 public schools; 5,700 charter schools, and 30,900 private schools during the 2011-2012 school year.
In 2014, about 49.8 million students are attending to public elementary and secondary schools. 
~ 35.1 million are in prekindergarten through grade 8.
~14.7 million were registered grades 9 through 12. 
~4.1 million public school students are enrolled in 9th grade ( high school) (source).
~5.0 million students are attending to private schools (source).
The most money $$$$$$$$ raised the most schools, and places Uncle Sam's Lady, and her world friends would be able to visit and to impact.
Another of our future goals is to build a Teamwork to have an E-UNCLE SAM'S LADY MAGAZINE version too among many other promotional items, and events.
LOVE, Creativity, Perseverance, Dedication, Organization, Survivency, Leasing, Monetary Investment, Funding, Art Supplies, Artwork,  Sketching, Drawing,  Painting, Printing & Shipping Services, Technology, Softwares, Animation, Graphic Designing, Editing, Writing, Translating,Proofreading. Research, Covering Submission Deadlines, Publishing, Networking, Distributing, Press Releases, Advertising campaigns, Updating, Supervising, Public Relations, Overtime,Caring People & more is where your generous DONATION will go. 

                                   THANK YOU ~ MUCHAS  GRACIAS
                        FOR BEING ONE OF THE USL 2015 FOUNDERS

As an artist, journalist and former teacher, I truly believe that it will be great to count with your valuable support to make it true.                                           
~ Maybe you cannot contribute but it doesn't mean you can't help:
~Ask your folks to get the word out and make some noise about this      campaign.
~Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

                    

                     Give back & Receive Back!             

        

                  Health & Prosperity be with You :)

All rights reserved. story:
Together We Can Help Save 1 Million Children's Lives

I’m Clement (the one in Black shirt as ususal LOL), a Malaysian currently working in a multinational company. I’m just a normal office worker that enjoys life with monthly salary from a good and reputable company

A life changing partnership

"The Company That I've worked with" and "Save the Children" have formed a ground breaking global partnership, combining our expertise and resources to help save the lives of one million children.

This week all the employees in my company, around the world will get involved in the partnership through out this whole week in raising fund to SAVE the Children.

I'm delighthed to be part of it and would like to play a part in helping the Childrens to gain back their future!

What We Need 

My Goal is to raised $13860 in 1 week Time.

The No. derived from:

$231 Can pay for a health worker’s salary for a whole month so they can deliver babies safely, diagnose illnesses and give life-saving treatment to sick children 

$231 * 12 Months * 5 Years = $13860

Yes! by reaching this goal, we can fund a worker for 5 years in doing his job for the Children!

I know this is an enormous task for me as a 1st timer, but remember that each $1 contribution from you is a small step for me to achieve my Goal as well as The Company that I work with & SaveTheChidren

The Impact

This is how your donation will make a difference:

* $5 – Could buy life-saving treatment for eight children with diarrhoea


* $8 – Could buy a mosquito net to reduce a child’s chances of being infected with malaria


* $15 – Could buy a baby kit for a health worker to distribute on her rounds including clothes, towels, nappies and soap


* $62 – Can help vaccinate a child against many preventable childhood illnesses


* $154 – Trains a health worker to ensure that they can provide life-saving care for new-born babies and their mothers


* $231 - Can pay for a health worker’s salary for a whole month so they can deliver babies safely, diagnose illnesses and give life-saving treatment to sick children

So please give as much as you can - and play your part in helping save the lives of some of the world’s most vulnerable children.

Thank you,

Clement Hoh for the Children!

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone is able to support monetarily as much as they would like, but you can still contribute. Please help support this project by spreading words about this campaign, sharing it using Indiegogo sharing tools and telling others the story of How we can help to SAVE 1 Million Children Lives Together in any Social Media Platform

Just asking your friend to LIKE the link in Facebook or Youtube is already helping to reach out to the right person, whether as a contributor or someone who simply wants to be part of it... :)

**Pictures & Video from:

  • fresh.amazon.com
  • http://www.savethechildren.org.uk/
  • www.athgo.org

story:
Yes She Has

Congratulations! 

Stephanie has been accepted into the Women's Campaign School at Yale University, June 10-14, 2013 in New Haven, CT. 

Last year, women from only a dozen nations and 18 U.S. states were accepted into the program! 

Yes She Is

Stephanie is a proven leader and public servant.

In 2003, Stephanie became the first woman to represent District 7 on the parish (county) governing board, and only the second woman in its 171-year history to serve as President.  She was re-elected in 2007, and 2011. 

Stephanie serves as the Democratic Party Chair in Caddo Parish, is President of the National Association of Black County Officials, and is a member of the leadership team of the National Association of Counties. 

Yes She Will

Stephanie is running for City Council, District F

Yes, Stephanie will be running to become the first woman to represent District F on the Shreveport City Council in 2014, an open seat.  Attending the Women's Campaign School at Yale will lay the foundation for a successful campaign. 

Yes You Can!

Please Contribute.  No amount is too small. 

You would be surprised how amounts of even $5 can add up!  For basically the cost of a Big Mac Meal, you can help Stephanie reach her goal.  Thank you so much and spread the word to all of your family and FB friends. 

To read more information about this training, click this link: http://www.wcsyale.org/.

story:
Short Summary

Hello! My name is Turhan Douglas. I have been a physical educator, strengh and conditioning coach, and volleyball coach for over 20 years. As the father of 5 home schooled children, I was surprised to see the lack of resourses for physical education cirriculum, so I decided to create a way for parents to help their children get fit while meeting the mandated physical activity requirements. My mission is to promote families exercising together in a fun, challanging and effective way. 
This DVD series will be comprised of three disciplines: Mixed Martial Arts, Calisthenics, and Latin Dance.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $50,000 to fund our project. The costs include the following:
Production costs
    •    Directors fees   - $1,500
    •    Crew   - $5,400
    •    Equipment   - $3,500
    •    Props and wardrobe   - $1,000
    •    Meals   - $800
    •    Talent   - $1,800
    •    Permits and fees   - $3,000
Post Production Costs
    •    Offline editing   - $20,000
    •    Graphics   - $4,000
    •    Dubs   - $6,000
    •    Other costs   - $3,000
 
For your generous contributions you will receive anywhere from a Thank-you on our Face book page to an all expense paid trip to the set and appearance on the video. Any contribution big or small is greatly appeciated.
 

The Impact

The consequences of the sedentary lifestyles lived by so many of our young people are grave,  In the long run, physical inactivity threatens to reverse the decades long progress we have made in reducing death and suffering from cardiovascular diseases.  A physically inactive population is at increased risk for many chronic diseases, including heart disease, stroke, colon cancer, diabetes, osteoporosis.  In addition to the toll taken by human suffering, surges in the prevalence of these diseases could lead to crippling increases in our national health care expenditures.

With so many schools failingng to meet the physical needs of our children, with your contribution, together, we can empower parents and their children with the tools necessary to meet those needs in a fun, challenging, and effective way.
 
Our Website!

Check out our Website.
 http://www.fitfamilyproductions.com/
story_txt:
Short Summary










Hello! My name is Turhan Douglas. I have been a physical educator, strengh and conditioning coach, and volleyball coach for over 20 years. As the father of 5 home schooled children, I was surprised to see the lack of resourses for physical education cirriculum, so I decided to create a way for parents to help their children get fit while meeting the mandated physical activity requirements. My mission is to promote families exercising together in a fun, challanging and effective way. This DVD series will be comprised of three disciplines: Mixed Martial Arts, Calisthenics, and Latin Dance.
 







 





What We Need & What You Get










We need $50,000 to fund our project. The costs include the following:
Production costs    •    Directors fees   - $1,500    •    Crew   - $5,400    •    Equipment   - $3,500    •    Props and wardrobe   - $1,000    •    Meals   - $800    •    Talent   - $1,800    •    Permits and fees   - $3,000Post Production Costs    •    Offline editing   - $20,000    •    Graphics   - $4,000    •    Dubs   - $6,000    •    Other costs   - $3,000
 
For your generous contributions you will receive anywhere from a Thank-you on our Face book page to an all expense paid trip to the set and appearance on the video. Any contribution big or small is greatly appeciated.

story: Hello world wide web, my name is Isaiah and I am a full time college student majoring in Music and Sound Technology at Valencia College located in Orlando Florida. Summer term is around the corner and I can only enroll in 2 classes due to time conflicts. This pains me, because I was going to graduate with an A.S. Degree in Fall 2013, but now I have to stay an extra semester and financial aid will cover a portion of my fees(I hope). I've also just moved out on my own with a friend, so on top of rent, and bills I'll be stuck with school fees that I don't think I'll be able to pay. I don't want to put college on hold due to the fact that I can't afford it on my own. I've been filling out tons of scholarships each semester and I have yet won a scholarship. That is why I am here now hoping that people will see this and donate their hard earned money, so that I can continue on with my education and be the first one to graduate college out of my brothers and sisters. I have made it this far, and now I just need a little help from you, the people of the world wide web. Thank you :)

story:
Hello! My name is Cailin Elphick and I am a recent graduates of the Academy of the New Church. I grew up in Oak Arbor, Michigan and have spent the last two years in Bryn Athyn attending the Academy.

This summer I am traveling to Nepal for the month of July to help out with the Loving Arms Mission, a charity with strong Bryn Athyn and New Church roots. There are two orphanages in Nepal that the Mission runs, and I am going for a month to do volunteer work for the organization. I will be helping with anything they need, such as; assisting the children with their schoolwork, helping fix up the building, and making an informational video for the organization.

International volunteer work is something I have been passionate about and always wanted to do, and I have been researching and planning this trip all year. It is so important to me to be able to give back to the world and help out on this level. I believe so strongly in what this organization stands for and I am honored to be able to help out such a conscientious and wonderful cause. However, I cannot do it alone, I need help with funds for my trip. I have been working hard to pay for the trip myself, and have saved up all year, but in order to be able to afford to make a difference in these kids lives we need your support and any contribution helps. Unfortunatly, Luke David is no longer able to go on the trip. The $3000 was an estimation of what we would of needed if two people were going, but now that it is just me, I will only need $1000 (if this changes your donation please get in contact with me) and if I surpass that amount, all the proceeds will go directly to fund the Loving Arms Mission. If you are not in a position to donate, please just spread the word around about my project! Thank you for your care and generosity; I am extremely grateful.

If you have any further questions, please contact me at cailinnn@live.com, Thank you!

 

If you are interested here is a little more about The Loving Arms Mission:

Loving Arms Mission: Formed in 1997, the Loving Arms Mission is a not-for-profit organization based in Bryn Athyn,PA. We are a charitable organization registered as a 501 (c) (3) with the US federal government, and we are also registered with the Pennsylvania State Bureau of Charitable Organizations. The purpose of the Loving Arms Mission is to provide exceptional care to orphaned, abandoned and at risk children on all levels of their being–physical, mental, emotional and spiritual. We provide this care by raising and channeling funds to orphanages and children’s homes which are well-run by dedicated staff and which provide what we deem to be the best possible care.

Our goal is the wellbeing of the children we help. We believe that true wellbeing exists only as a result of the fulfillment of the natural needs, food, clothing, shelter and healthcare in conjunction with the nourishment of a child’s heart, mind and spirit as well. What follows is an explanation of how we attempt to properly nourish these needs of our children.

https://www.facebook.com/lovingarmsmission 

http://lamchildren.org/main/about-lam/

story:
Hi Everyone, 

As you know Megan just got into graduate school at the University of Sydney in Australia! I couldn't be more proud, and excited for her! This is an amazing opportunity for her to grow, learn, and continue her education and travel. Unfortunately, education comes with a price, a price that most people, including myself, cannot afford. Subsequently, Megan must reach out to everyone's new best friend, financial aid. However, as most of you know, financial aid doesn't provide the aid in the necessary time needed. It should be called "Delayed Aid", but that’s another story.

This is where your help and support comes in. Megan needs $3,000 to secure her spot at the University of Sydney by October 1, 2013. Confiding in me of these financial worries, I decided something had to be done about this. So like any good friend I am making this public to all her friends and family ;). Every little bit helps!! 

Sincerely,

Amanda

story:
*Photos taken from One Year Lease website

Why Campaign?

Have you ever felt you were born in the wrong time period? I have always thought I was an "old soul," not meant for my generation. Years ago I asked, "Shay, if you could travel back in time, which period would you go?" I answered, "the Classical period of Greece." (Seriously, not kidding). The art and philosophy that flourished during that time have always attracted me. Albert Einstein unfortunately only proved we could travel a couple minutes into the future-- not decades into the past. Luckily, an opportunity to experience what I have always dreamt of has fallen into my grasp. 

Every year, the New York Based theater company One Year Lease (oneyearlease.org) holds a month long summer apprenticeship in Greece. Only fourteen artists are accepted each year; myself being one of the lucky few. The program is an opportunity that stands out amongst the rest. The Apprenticeship is lead by legendary professional artisits Kim Weild and Gabriel Cody. Amongst the famous Suzuki, Meisner, Lecoq, and Viewpoints training, I will be allowed access to the company's business production meetings and will have 45 minutes of Greek lessons each day. The highlight of the program will be working on the production of The Birds by Greek playwright Aristophanes. Even the thought of performing a 1500 year old Greek classic in Greece gives me goose bumps. The prgram dates: July 18th-August 18th.

Acting and the arts are more than just my hobbies; they are my passions. Most importantly, they cleave together to form a life long career path. Through this opportunity I will hone my craft and learn how to better market myself as an artist to potential future employers. I will also be able to better market my own devised creations. 

I am calling for help with the cost of attendence of this wonderful program.

  • Total cost of attendence: (+ food, room and board, excursions, plane ticket): $6,600.                                                                                                
  • I have raised: $4,719. 
  • What I still need to raise: $1,881.

I will continue to search for loans/grants/scholarships and save money from work. However, ANY contribution you are willing or able to make is GREATLY apprecitated; the positive impact of this program on my life would change me forever.

If you cannot contribute, that is perfectly understandable! If you could please spread the word (see Indiegogo share tools) that helps just as much. 

**Indiegogo will deduct 4% from the total money raised IF I meet my goal. However, if I do not. They will deduct 9%. 

 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR TIME!

story:
Hi! My name is Alison Gale Lotspeich and I have a passion for flight!

I have researched for years and taken the necessary steps toward obtaining my Private Pilot License. Now, the only obstruction is funding. My overall goal is to immerse myself into the aviation community and eventually pursue a career in the field. Can you help me?

I truly believe that to aid and inspire others; one must continue to aid and inspire oneself. I have dedicated my life to do just that.

Currently, and for the better part of the last decade I have worked as a Certified Nursing Assistant specializing in Dementia Care. It has been a challenging and rewarding adventure, and I love the work that I do. I feel blessed and humbled to have been there for individuals and families when they need someone most.

Aside from that job, I also train in and perform various circus arts! Under the stage name Gale Force, I have entertained audiences around the country with high-energy performances on aerial fabric, hoop, and even a rocket ship! Stilt walking, unicycling, and hula hooping are some of the other ways I push the limits of human physicality and there is always room to grow.


The breakdown:


As you may know, this goal of $3,000 is a mere fraction of what I will need for materials, aircraft rental, instruction hours, and testing. In case you don't, I am looking at approximately $9,000 for the Private Pilot certificate alone (with which, according to the FAA, does not allow me to fly for hire). There will be more expenses once I work toward my Commercial license. But, if you can help me clear this first hurdle, I know I can make this dream a reality!

I am already in the process of obtaining books and tools I will need from discount sites like Ebay and Amazon, and have found some helpful books at used book stores. Any other advice or tips on where I can cut corners while still being safe and legal is greatly appreciated!

 If you can help me meet my goal monetarily, great! Please check out my "perks" section for some awesome thank-you gifts! If you can't, no worries! I will generously accept an enthusiastic, "You go, girl!" I need all the love and support you can give me. Thank you!

 

The sky is not the limit!
