story:
Short Summary

I started Minds Matter Last Summer after teaching in the public system for five years.  In those years, I encountered so many families that needed educational support and didn't know where to turn.  I met so many wonderful, talented, caring passionate teachers, not getting the support they need to help their students be successful.  I also noticed that too many teachers were getting sick from all of the stress they were experiencing as classroom teachers.  Physically ill... I noticed that parents weren't being included in their children's educational lives and many were clueless to what their children were learning.  I saw smart children who were frustrated and hurting because they weren't receiving the educational support that they needed to be successful. I decided that if change is going to happen and things are going to improve, action needs to take place, so I put in my resignation, invested my retirement fund in Minds Matter and got to work.

I was able to secure a leaning center and pay the rent through this June, buy the furniture we need, hold learning fair and get the supplies we needed to get started.  This was a huge and exciting step!  We now have 5 families that we are helping empower and it's time to start helping other families.  With your help, this dream can become a reality; and together, we will be the catalysts of change for a BETTER EDUCATIONAL FUTURE.

The mission of Minds Matter Educational Services is to "Empower Learners, Parents and Teachers so their Gifts Can Shine."  This is achieved through educational coaching and workshops for parents, tutoring and enrichment classes for learners and online instructional videos to reach learners and parents all over the world.  Our philosophy is that every learner is an individual and education should be an experience unique and tailored to the interests and needs of each person.  We create a safe, positive environment for teachers as well as learners, so they can do what they do best and focus on helping students and parents achieve success on their educational journeys. Our teacher are certified, qualified and passionate about learning and teaching.   We are on a mission to prove that MINDS DO MATTER and learning, whatever path is chosen (public, private or home school) can be a fun, positive experience!

Half of every dollar that surpasses our goal goes into a scholarship fund to provide educational services to low income families.  100% of that money will immediately go toward providing educational support for a family.  It provides: tuition for the learner, educational workshops and training for the parents and a backpack filled with the supplies they need to continue learning at home.  As part of the program, the learner will write you letters periodically to let you know how they are doing.  You will be helping them improve their reading and writing skills as well as providing them with the educational support they need to be successful!

We will take the scholarships to schools in the area and let them distribute them to the families that they think could benefit most from educational support.  

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to reach $5000 dollars.  As we reach this goal, we will be able to buy supplies for our students and learning center, work on our video project, secure our location for the next year and create some materials to get the word out about our mission and how we can help families experience a successful and joyful educational journey.  When we surpass our goal, we will provide scholarships for families in need, continue to grow so we can help as many families as possible and start on the next phase of our project: Minds Matter Special Minds, a center where we provide the Horseboy Method horse assisted learning, an aquatic center and facilities for movement based learning, a nutrition center, a resource center for families and much more to cater to learners with special needs. This will help so many families and teachers! This, we are VERY excited about!

As a contributor, you will become a V.I.P. member of the Minds Matter family and receive educational rewards from us for supporting our mission.

The Impact

Change has a ripple effect.  For every parent and learner that takes charge of their learning journey and has a wonderful experience with education, a wave of change has begun.  As time goes on, the positive change spreads and more and more people are empowered. The impact of this mission is going to be huge; people all over the world will take charge of learning and inspire others to do the same! 

A great part of our mission is to create a positive experience for teachers who love to teach.  We believe in what we are doing and thank you for supporting us! As we grow, we will be able to give more teachers jobs, provide them with training and materials and meet their needs so their gifts can shine. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can spread the word about Minds Matter and our mission!  Our Facebook page is at www.facebook.com/mindsmatteredu. We appreciate you telling anyone that may benefit from Minds Matter about what we do.  Thank You!

I decided that if change is going to happen and things are going to improve, action needs to take place, so I put in my resignation, invested my retirement fund in Minds Matter and got to work.
I was able to secure a leaning center and pay the rent through this June, buy the furniture we need, hold learning fair and get the supplies we needed to get started.  This was a huge and exciting step!  We now have 5 families that we are helping empower and it's time to start helping other families.  With your help, this dream can become a reality; and together, we will be the catalysts of change for a BETTER EDUCATIONAL FUTURE.
The mission of Minds Matter Educational Services is to "Empower Learners, Parents and Teachers so their Gifts Can Shine."  This is achieved through educational coaching and workshops for parents, tutoring and enrichment classes for learners and online instructional videos to reach learners and parents all over the world.  Our philosophy is that every learner is an individual and education should be an experience unique and tailored to the interests and needs of each person.  We create a safe, positive environment for teachers as well as learners, so they can do what they do best and focus on helping students and parents achieve success on their educational journeys. Our teacher are certified, qualified and passionate about learning and teaching.   We are on a mission to prove that MINDS DO MATTER and learning, whatever path is chosen (public, private or home school) can be a fun, positive experience!
Half of every dollar that surpasses our goal goes into a scholarship fund to provide educational services to low income families.  100% of that money will immediately go toward providing educational support for a family.  It provides: tuition for the learner, educational workshops and training for the parents and a backpack filled with the supplies they need to continue learning at home.  As part of the program, the learner will write you letters periodically to let you know how they are doing.  You will be helping them improve their reading and writing skills as well as providing them with the educational support they need to be successful!
We will take the scholarships to schools in the area and let them distribute them to the families that they think could benefit most from educational support.  
What We Need & What You Get
Our goal is to reach $5000 dollars.  As we reach this goal, we will be able to buy supplies for our students and learning center, work on our video project, secure our location for the next year and create some materials to get the word out about our mission and how we can help families experience a successful and joyful educational journey.  When we surpass our goal, we will provide scholarships for families in need, continue to grow so we can help as many families as possible and start on the next phase of our project: Minds Matter Special Minds, a center where we provide the Horseboy Method horse assisted learning, an aquatic center and facilities for movement based learning, a nutrition center, a resource center for families and much more to cater to learners with special needs. This will help so many families and teachers! This, we are VERY excited about!
As a contributor, you will become a V.I.P. member of the Minds Matter family and receive educational rewards from us for supporting our mission.
The Impact
Change has a ripple effect.  For every parent and learner that takes charge of their learning journey and has a wonderful experience with education, a wave of change has begun.  As time goes on, the positive change spreads and more and more people are empowered. The impact of this mission is going to be huge; people all over the world will take charge of learning and inspire others to do the same! 
A great part of our mission is to create a positive experience for teachers who love to teach.  We believe in what we are doing and thank you for supporting us! As we grow, we will be able to give more teachers jobs, provide them with training and materials and meet their needs so their gifts can shine. 
Other Ways You Can Help
You can spread the word about Minds Matter and our mission!  Our Facebook page is at www.facebook.com/mindsmatteredu. We appreciate you telling anyone that may benefit from Minds Matter about what we do.  Thank You!

story:
The Wandering Cub is a storybook for anyone who has had a hard time fitting in.

Based in Alaska, where the author works as a park ranger, it follows a mama bear and her three cubs. One cub often gets distracted and wanders away. The book shares the misadventures of this wandering cub, and her journey to learn she is loved just the way she is. 

It is inspired by a real bear family seen near the Mendenhall Glacier in 2016 - tagged bear #25 and her three cubs, one of whom gained a reputation for getting lost. 

It may be read independently by ages 5-105, and is a great gift to let someone know they are very loved, flaws and all.

Our Story

Hi from Istanbul,

I'm a journalist, used to work for Turkish daily Milliyet many many years, nowadays I love to help people anywhere,


Last month I met the girl in train, subway who desperately wants to go in University in spite of her family


she won the university exam sheltering 75% sponsorship by Kemerburgaz University, she needs to have rest of  25%


She just start to go university but suspicious about her family will cut monthly payment


The Impact


I have to find regarding total for her future otherwise she cant go on educate

What We Need & What You Get


I have to find regarding rest of total  2500 USD, to give her

for university fee session 2011


Other Ways You Can Help

story:
I have launched my website www.booksmatter.org    Please visit to see how you can help us ship 1,000's more books to Ghana school children!!

 

What's this Campaign About?

Long Story Short:

There are virtually no books in Ghana (hard to believe but true; see Gallery video)

I'm sending 700 books to a school in Ghana, made up of the following:

200 math txtbks (app value = $8,000)

500 story bks, for ages 5-14 (app value = $3,000)

You may say that there are bigger problems in the world, and that might be true. However, this plan is very cost effective and quick to implement. Here's why:

  • There is no bureaucracy involved and no red tape
  • My campaign closes mid-August and I ship the books
  • They arrive in Ghana at the end of September or mid October
  • By mid to late October the books are in the school and the students have access to them

I hear the school is even planning a big ceremony for the arrival of the books!!

Let's face it, even I love getting a new book now and then, and these kids don't have ANY.

 

Imagine... if everyone who visits this site pledges just $2 (the cost of a coffee), we will reach our goal!

 

The Details

My name is Keith and I have been a teacher in Toronto for over 15 years. I have travelled to Ghana, West Africa four times in the past and I've realized that there is something very simple that I can do to help a lot of school children there. I can send them books that Toronto schools no longer use and just throw out! Most schools in Ghana have a very small supply of books, if any at all. Kids spend HOURS a day, copying info that is dictated by the teacher or written on the board, into their "copy books" because there are no textbooks. In the past few months I have collected about 700 books from Toronto schools; the books had been stored away in cupboards for years! All I need is a small amount of money to ship the books and get them to the school that I'm in touch with. This will have an immediate impact on what the kids can learn, how quickly they can learn it, and will also allow some kids to work at home.

How I Will Use the Money

I have enough books to fill three shipping containers (barrels) right now. I can ship each container (by sea) to Ghana for about $175. The shipper I have used in the past is very reliable. The shipping takes about six weeks and when the books arrive in Ghana, I can have them delivered from the coast to my school (Bright Future School) for about $125 per container. The school is located in Keta, in the Volta Region, which is a few hours drive from the warehouse in Accra, where the books will be sent after arriving. (See gallery pic of students w. yellow uniforms to see the school I'm sending to).

My Connection to Ghana

My wife is from Ghana and her father is a retired school teacher in Ghana. She has told me stories about how much time school children spend copying notes off of the board or notes dictated from the teacher. This even happens at some post-secondary institutions, if you can believe it. We are all aware of the difficult circumstances that many African children have to overcome and this is a simple, relatively inexpensive way to really help them to help themselves.

If you can't contribute, thanks for reading this and please pass on the story.

story:
Foreward from Karen:

HELLO!! Thank you for visiting my campaign! My name is Karen Wright and I started this fundraiser for my sister Jennifer. She is an amazing person who has worked so hard to get where she is today. I know she deserves to go back to school! I am excited to see how far this next opportunity will take her, as she has already helped as a role model to those who have struggled with chronic pain. I hope you, too, will find her story to be inspirational.  

ABOUT ME  

Hi. I am Jennifer Jones, an average American woman from NJ and on a mission.  *I appreciate you're taking time to read*

Back story:

Due to a bad car accident in 1997, damage led to the diagnosis of several chronic pain disorders. During the first 10 year period, I was prescribed 53 different pharmaceuticals equaling over 70,000 pills. After the wheelchair and walker, I utilized lofstran crutches to hold me up while I dragged my legs from behind.  I gained 150 pounds (and developed arthritis in my spine) from spending the majority of time bedridden. At times, a full on chore was getting myself to the bathroom, even with assistance. Many days had the single goal of getting a shower. I was merely surviving. I had had enough. I wanted to live.

The Transformation:

In 2007, I sought out alternative medicine and through the discipline of many practices: yoga, meditation, changing diet and adjusting routines,  my body was supported in removing the narcotics and majority of medications. I have finally weaned myself off the last pharmaceutical (for nerve pain) this January! Seeing as I had been through 10 hard detox's- (sweats, chills, profound depression, vomiting, nausea & horrific body pain) I do not ever want to go through that again. So, personal studies have taken on an exploration of more natural, similarly effective, less side effect options. I have lost 157 pounds, triglycerides dropped from 1400's to 70s & I can touch my toes again!  The effects of these holistic practices have been witnessed personally, through observation of my physicians, family and friends and scientifically through various tests. There is no doubt that this transformation was... dramatic.

My Goal and Funding:

My goal is to get to school in mid September for Holistic Nutrition and Western Herbalism. Yes, I am asking for help. The ambition, motivation and determination are all in place, funding however is not. Starting all over and saving for awhile now, still short. Donations will offset school expenses: classes and materials, housing and transportation. I hope that you will find a reason to choose my campaign as your gift will not be wasted. I have much to do in this lifetime and many lives I wish to have a positive impact on. Wisdoms learned, need to be shared.

Come, be a part of the Story!

Gifts:

Contributors receiving a bead from the bead chain exhibit will get a handcrafted gift card, each numbered and signed. Replacement beads will carry contributors name (or initials) and corresponding card number.  {*beads were recycled, repurposed and donated to this display*} 

~**How incredibly fragile the human body, how incredibly resilient.**~

 

**I would like to sincerely thank my sister, Karen for starting this page in continued support of reaching my goals.

Thank you Green Day- this song resonates with me deeply.

NOTE- The opening photograph is made of MY pill containers from the 10 years following the accident...1,102 in total.

story:
Campaign Basics


Wild orangutans are in BIG trouble.

Help me save them through a unique scholarship program in Sumatra and Borneo- the only two places where wild orangutans are found in the world.

 

My Story: I have been interested and concerned about orangutans for nearly 40 years. In the 1970s I conducted pioneering research on the intelligence and language abilities of captive and excaptive orangutans in California and in Borneo. In the 1980s I co-founded a nonprofit that helped rehabilitate excaptive orangutans in Borneo. Now I want to stop the killing of wild orangutans and insure their survival for future generations. EDUCATION (not rehabilitation) is the key.

 

 

The Program: The Orang Utan Republik Foundation (OURF), a 501c3 nonprofit organization I co-founded in 2007, has been collaborating with the Orangutan Information Center in Sumatra and the Palung Foundation in Borneo to fund an important scholarship program in the name of the great red ape: the Orangutan Caring Scholarship. Students that receive the scholarship go to school, conduct research on orangutans, and volunteer for the Indonesian partner organizations. When the students graduate, they become advocates and supporters for orangutan survival. Some become field biologists, veterinarians, forestry officers, teachers, and professionals in the private and public sector.  

The orangutan is critically endangered on Sumatra and endangered on Borneo as its habitat, the tropical rainforest, is converted for human use. 

How it works: OURF finds the funds and the Indonesian organizations administers the program. They promote the competitive program, evaluate the applicants and research proposal, and make the selections following each applicant's presentation to the panel of judges. Each scholarship costs about $1500 and provides tuition funding over a 4-year period, the normal time it takes for an undergraduate student to obtain a degree in the fields of biology and forestry. Veterinarian students take an extra year.

Since beginning the program in 2006, OURF has funded 47 scholarships. Many of students have already graduated and are working in government and nongovernment sectors. Some have gone on to graduate school. We want to keep the funds coming so we can graduate more and more appreciative and knowledgeable citizens in the country there most orangutans are found.

Scholarship funds have usually come from orangutan and other nonprofit organizations but with collaboration from people like you, we can prepare for the 2013 Scholarship program and we can keep the program sustained. 

How you can help: I want to see if our campaign can raise enough funds to support six scholarships in 2013: $9,000. By keeping funding participation affordable, we can raise those funds.... possibly even more.

What We Need & What You Will Get

We need to raise $9,000 to fund 6 scholarships in 2013. Frankly we want to fund more scholarships and will be seeking additional funds for our scholarship fund through other venues. But to get the $9,000, we have developed a menu of seven levels of participation:

                  $10, $20, $50, $100, $500, $1,500, & $5,000

With those choices, anyone can participate and contribute to this important program.  In most cases, these contributions are fully tax-deductible.

Here is what you or some you choose will get for your participation:

  • you will be thanked on our website for $10
  • a certificate of support plus a thank you for $20
  • a photo of the last class of recipients plus the above for $50
  • special annual membership plus all of the above for $100
  • an orangutan sculpture plus all the above for $500
  • Special recognition at our next fundraiser for $1,500
  • Special VIP recognition at our next fundraiser for $5,000

We made it so that it will take a mix of caring people to help us reach our goal. Will you be among those caring people?  We plan to deliver the certificates and photos by email as pdfs but we can also specially send them (at an additional cost) to people as a gift. Our goal is to raise as much as we can for the scholarships- not overhead for this program.  If we do not reach our $9,000 goal, we will apply whatever funds we receive towards the Orangutan Caring Scholarship fund.

The Impact: Orangutans and People Benefit

The Orangutan Caring Scholarship has grown over the last 7 years. It is bringing educational opportunities to students who wouldn't otherwise be able to go to college. It is branding the name: orangutan with something beneficial to local people. Here are some of the other benefits of the Orangutan Caring Scholarship program:

  • Young women are receiving higher education opportunities and choosing academics over large families.
  • The local press covering the award ceremonies also educate the public about orangutans and their plight.
  • Good will is generated in predominately Muslim communities during a time where more Western good will is needed.
  • Orangutans are gaining knowledgeable Indonesian advocates that will speak out on their behalf.

Here is what some of the past recipients have said about receiving the Orangutan Caring Scholarship (OCS):

"the OCS has allowed me to actively get involved in field works conducted by the OIC to save the orangutans and ther habitat. After I graduated from my study, I first worked as a forestry consultant for a company in Aceh but now I am working as a financial analyist for a national bank in Medan where I can teach my conservation knowledge to many companies who are dealing with my services."     -Syarifah Lia Andriati, the first recipient of the Orangutan Caring Scholarship.

"It took me about more than six months to complete my research, but I am now relieved and feel satisfied as I have finished my research and my study with distinction. I am now looking for a career opportunity, and I really hope that I can get a job that will allow me to help conserve orangutans and their rainforest home." -Fifi Wilyanti, 2008 recipient

"I was awarded the OCS in 2008 and I was very pleased to know that the OCS allowed me to become a volunteer in OIC, a local conservation NGO dedicated to conservation of Sumatran orangutan. By the time I was awarded the OCS, I knew that I would learn  more about the orangutans and how I could help protect this important species. I graduated in 2010.  I hope my research can be widely published so many people will learn more about orangutans. I am now awaiting job interview for the position of a biologist for a conservation NGO based in Medan." -Nurzaidah Putri Dalimunthe, 2008 recipient.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you find it difficult to participate but see the benefit of this program for the long term survival of the orangutan, you can help in other ways besides contributing money:

  • Get the word out with your family and friends
  • Tweet the campaign, put it on your Facebook page.
  • See if your school, church or service organization wants to participate.

THANKS for taking the time to read this far... now, show me you care and take the next step!!

Even if you find it difficult to participate but see the benefit of this program for the long term survival of the orangutan, you can help in other ways besides contributing money:

Get the word out with your family and friends
Tweet the campaign, put it on your Facebook page.
See if your school, church or service organization wants to participate.

THANKS for taking the time to read this far... now, show me you care and take the next step!!

story: ........................

Short Summary

The Hamilton Youth Poetry Slam (HYPS) is Hamilton’s first Youth slam and was created to give Youth a chance to have their voices heard. Once a month HYPS offers youth, poets and audiences alike the opportunity to take part in free workshops, share on the open mic, and listen to the voices of young poets sharing their original work in the friendly competition of Slam. 

What is a Slam?  Slam poetry is the competitive art of performance poetry. It puts a dual emphasis on writing and performance, encouraging poets to focus on what they're saying and how they're saying it.... but remember, "The points are not the point; the point is poetry" The goal of a slam is to encourage the growth and strength of our artistic community, and in and of it’s self, that’s poetry.

HYPS has been given the opportunity to attend “Louder Than A Bomb”(LTAB)
LTAB is the worlds largest youth poetry festival in the world. It is a safe space that emphasizes community building, education, and youth empowerment. LTAB gathers the best and brightest young writers who work collaboratively to create an environment of mutual trust and support. For many youth, being a part of such an environment—is life-changing.

What We Need & What You Get

We are taking 9 youth with us to Chicago to attend, compete, and experience LTAB. The total cost per person $950 for a total of $8550. We've gathered $2750 

This leaves us with a total of $5800 left to raise.

COOL PERKS

Personalized poems
HYP-Slam t-shirts
HYP-Slam season passes
Live performance
LOTS OF GRATTITUDE

All donations are welcome to lower the per-youth cost on this trip. We look forward to the experiences we'll share and remain deeply grateful for the opportunity you created. 

The Impact

The experience of attending LTAB offers youth a life changing experience, along with coaching, professional development, cultural exchange, workshops, international collaborations, and the opporunity to share their stories and communities on an international stage. 

WHAT DOES POETRY DO FOR YOUTH? WHY IS POETRY IMPORTANT TO THEM?

"Poetry gives me a voice”

"It is empowerment and salvation. Most importantly, it’s support. Knowing that we are not alone. 

"Spoken word is freedom."

“It gave me life”

 "I want to build a community where everyone is accepted. And poetry lets me do this"

“Three minutes of pure weightlessness.”

“Inspires, motivates, uplifts, enlightens, releases”

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that sometimes you just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean we can't use your help. It would mean so much to us if you could get the word out and make some noise about HYP-Slam and our campaign. Sharing this page with friends & family via Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, email, and any other means of communication. Please continue to help us make history!

story:
I’m Keri Robin, and this is…

My Story

Breast Cancer has been in my life since 1984 when my mother was diagnosed at the young age of 43 years old.  Mom suffered through years of chemotherapy and radiation,  and she endured years of estrogen suppression pills.  Fifteen years later, after we were told that she was cured, the cancer came back and took her life.  She did everything she was told to do, but it still came back.  Why?

                                        

Then I became a victim at the age of 48 and was obsessed with determining the cause of my cancer.  You see, besides my mother, I didn't fit the standard risk factors.  I was not overweight, I exercised regularly, I took no birth control or hormone pills, my BRCA (breast cancer)  gene came back negative and I did not drink alcohol or smoke.

The doctors were only interested in killing the cancer, not finding out what was wrong with my body that caused the disease to form.  However, a knowledgeable doctor tested me for deficiencies.  I had a leaky gut, toxic mercury levels, high lead levels and vitamin shortages.  My liver was actually trying to make Vitamin C!  My oxygen level was in the eighties and I was very acidic. Through my own layman's research, I discovered all of these elements left my immune system fighting everything else but the cancer.  These were MY risk factors!

The Impact

Surviving Breast Cancer has to be learned.  You must be committed to make alterations in your life.  You must be diligent to rid your body of toxins that are blocking the immune system.  It also means rewiring your brain to accept these changes in your lifestyle.

What Is Needed

I need your support to obtain a Recreational Therapy degree and become a Certified Health Coach specializing in breast cancer survival.  I plan to use the educational credentials to:                                                           

1)  Help Breast Cancer victims with wellness education and positive image reinforcement activities.

2)  Teach all girls and women to recognize the toxins associated with this disease and adopt healthy lifestyle changes.

3)  Conduct touring seminars to reach beyond my community.

Where The Funds Go

Funds raised will go towards tuition with a small donation to the Breast Cancer Fund and the Aggies for Christ / Missions.

What You Get

To start or enhance your Breast Cancer Prevention Program, I offer a wonderful variety of really awesome perks as a great big THANK YOU for your contribution!  (I am not able to ship internationally.)                      

                      

Other Ways You Can Help

Using the Indiegogo tools, take a few moments to share this campaign with every Breast Cancer victim you know and every woman you love.


Freebies!

Weekly Referral Contests

6 winners in all!

While logged into your free Indiegogo account, use the share tools to invite everyone you know to view my campaign.  A special ID will be given to link the referral view to you.  (Please don’t spam)  At the end of the week, Sun-Sat, whoever had the most referral views will win a $100.00 Restaurant.com Discount Card!  Card is valid at over 50,000 participating restaurants nationwide!

First 500

The first 500 contributors will receive a pink ribbon charm.  Perfect for your bracelet or necklace.

Combined Contribution Reward

At any time your referrals contribute a combined amount equal to $500.00, I will send you a beautiful Sunflower Bouquet Tapestry Throw absolutely free!  This 100% cotton throw is 54” x 60” and is made in the USA.  **Contributions can only be counted if your referrals donate through your special ID link.

story:
Hi my name is Jessica Rees and I am currently studying photography, media studies and English literature and language at college.

As part of my education and life experiences, next July I am off to Kenya to  work with children in deprived areas. I will help out in the school and community hopefully bringing a smile to the children's faces, and a chance of helping their education.


Personally, helping children has always inspired me, and I hope that when I return from Kenya aged 17, I am in a position to further develop my charitable work whilst continuing my education at University.


The reason I have set up this page is that the cost of the flights and accommodation need to be met, and that this project will also teach me some key skills in not only raising funds but in myself undertaking challenges to understand and appreciate that my short term pain is irrelevant compared to the challenges African children go through their whole lives.


Your generous support of my campaign will have and international effect...from small babies and children through to personal support of my ambitions.


I don't want to go to Kenya empty handed, so it's Biro and crayon time....to us these are pure consumables but to children in Africa these actually helps them write, draw, and express themselves. These children appreciate their limited education!

Please help and share my link.

story:
Why 11 Betties?

In 2014, many girls still feel like math is for boys, or for nerds, or for torture, but not for them. We believe we've been squeezing math and girls into one tiny box that they’re both far too interesting to fit into. Our mission is to empower girls to take joyful ownership of this historically male-driven subject by finding the math in everything that teenaged girls love. We seek to transform the idea of math from something that's irrelevant and boring to something that's essential and thrilling. See more at: www.11betties.org.

How did we begin?

After tutoring teenaged girls in math for the better part of a decade, Cate Scott Campbell discovered that her students' struggles in math had nothing to do with their level of smarts, and everything to do with a lack of connection. The feeling of, "What does this have to do with me?" Or, "I'm gonna do my math homework so I can go do the thing I really want to do." 

Cate took matters into her own hands and crafted lessons inspired by everything that she found moved her girls. 11 Betties was born.

“Instead of making girls fit math, I want to find everything that teenaged girls love or might love, and find the math in that.”

11 is Cate's favorite number. Cate says, “11 is symmetrical. I always make a wish at 11:11. And I believe that on a scale of 1-10, all women are at least 11’s.”

“Betties” comes from the movie Clueless: it's Cher’s term of endearment for a girl who’s got it going on. We strive to end the mutual exclusivity of being a Bettie and being good at math once and for all.

What do we plan to do?

We want to grow 11 Betties into a national force with programs in multiple cities, helping thousands of girls. To do this, we will:

  • Create educational videos and articles that inspire girls to understand math from their own unique point of view
  • Feature interactive chats and interviews with mathematicians, celebrities, and entrepreneurs who use math in unexpected ways
  • Expand our website to cover every relevant topic in math, academics, advice, and girl empowerment, and engage our teenaged readers to contribute their own articles and videos
  • Host live events around the country such as: talks in schools to ignite interest, focus groups to discover the specific struggles of all girls everywhere, field trips to educational and exciting places, and ongoing math clubs in which girls can discuss their challenges with one another and together take ownership of math

Where will our funding go?

Cate has put her entire savings into launching 11 Betties, and we are currently operating with the help of volunteers. There are hard costs associated both with launching and seeding a fruitful, long-term venture like ours. In order to expand and have national impact, we need your help. Your contributions will go directly to:

  • Legal fees: trademarking, releases, 501(c)(3) submission
  • Website development and maintenance costs
  • Video production for an 11 Betties YouTube channel that will feature educational math lessons, interviews with mathematicians, celebrities, and entrepreneurs who use math, and empowering advice
  • Venue rental for the Bettie Ball, an upcoming awareness event in Los Angeles
  • Commissions for articles, videos, and projects from educators, innovators, creatives, and teenaged girls
  • School supplies for girls in need
  • Volunteer stipends
  • Scholarships
  • Accounting services
  • T-shirts and book bags
  • Snacks and lunches
  • Travel expenses to schools in order to reach girls of all backgrounds

Breaking news! All of your donations are fully tax-deductible, thanks to our partnership with Social and Environmental Entrepreneurs (SEE). 

How can you help?

Your donation dollars will directly impact teenaged girls from all walks of life. Every little bit counts and will be used thoughtfully and constructively.

We'd also love your help getting the word out about 11 Betties -- both about this fundraiser and our project in general. We can't be everywhere and we don't know everyone who'll want to be involved -- yet, anyway -- so we really need your help. Sharing on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or your favorite online or in-person networks increases our chances of getting more girls to love math!

Fine print: If you are a teen girl (yay!) who wants to donate to our campaign, just make sure a parent signs off on it first! We can't wait to math with you.
